param.name: ArduCopter:FORMAT_VERSION
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.humanName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_THR_FILT
param.documentation: Throttle filter cutoff (Hz) - active whenever altitude control is inactive - 0 to disable

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_TKOFF_ALT
param.documentation: Altitude that altitude control modes will climb to when a takeoff is triggered with the throttle stick.

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_THR_BHV
param.documentation: Bitmask containing various throttle stick options. TX with sprung throttle can set PILOT_THR_BHV to "1" so motor feedback when landed starts from mid-stick instead of bottom of stick.
param.field: 0:Feedback from mid stick,1:High throttle cancels landing,2:Disarm on land detection

param.name: ArduCopter:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: ArduCopter:GCS_PID_MASK
param.documentation: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_ALT
param.documentation: The minimum alt above home the vehicle will climb to before returning. If the vehicle is flying higher than this value it will return at its current altitude.

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_CONE_SLOPE
param.documentation: Defines a cone above home which determines maximum climb

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally while flying home. If this is set to zero, WPNAV_SPEED will be used instead.

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_ALT_FINAL
param.documentation: This is the altitude the vehicle will move to as the final stage of Returning to Launch or after completing a mission. Set to zero to land.

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_CLIMB_MIN
param.documentation: The vehicle will climb this many cm during the initial climb portion of the RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_LOIT_TIME
param.documentation: Time (in milliseconds) to loiter above home before beginning final descent

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_ALT_TYPE
param.documentation: RTL altitude type. Set to 1 for Terrain following during RTL and then set WPNAV_RFND_USE=1 to use rangefinder or WPNAV_RFND_USE=0 to use Terrain database

param.name: ArduCopter:RNGFND_GAIN
param.documentation: Used to adjust the speed with which the target altitude is changed when objects are sensed below the copter

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_GCS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked (and what action to take) when connection with Ground station is lost for at least 5 seconds. See FS_OPTIONS param for additional actions, or for cases allowing Mission continuation, when GCS failsafe is enabled.

values.value: RTL or Continue with Mission in Auto Mode (Removed in 4.0+-see FS_OPTIONS)

param.name: ArduCopter:GPS_HDOP_GOOD
param.documentation: GPS Hdop value at or below this value represent a good position. Used for pre-arm checks

param.name: ArduCopter:SUPER_SIMPLE
param.documentation: Bitmask to enable Super Simple mode for some flight modes. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable Super Simple Mode

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR
param.documentation: Determines how the autopilot controls the yaw during missions and RTL

param.name: ArduCopter:LAND_SPEED
param.documentation: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

param.name: ArduCopter:LAND_SPEED_HIGH
param.documentation: The descent speed for the first stage of landing in cm/s. If this is zero then WPNAV_SPEED_DN is used

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_SPEED_UP
param.documentation: The maximum vertical ascending velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_ACCEL_Z
param.documentation: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_THR_ENABLE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode (Removed in 4.0+)

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_THR_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level in microseconds on channel 3 below which throttle failsafe triggers

param.name: ArduCopter:THR_DZ
param.documentation: The deadzone above and below mid throttle in PWM microseconds. Used in AltHold, Loiter, PosHold flight modes

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE1
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is <= 1230

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE2
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1230, <= 1360

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE3
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1360, <= 1490

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE4
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1490, <= 1620

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE5
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1620, <= 1749

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE6
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >=1750

param.name: ArduCopter:FLTMODE_CH
param.documentation: RC Channel to use for flight mode control

param.name: ArduCopter:INITIAL_MODE
param.documentation: This selects the mode to start in on boot. This is useful for when you want to start in AUTO mode on boot without a receiver.

param.name: ArduCopter:SIMPLE
param.documentation: Bitmask which holds which flight modes use simple heading mode (eg bit 0 = 1 means Flight Mode 0 uses simple mode)

param.name: ArduCopter:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

param.name: ArduCopter:ESC_CALIBRATION
param.documentation: Controls whether ArduCopter will enter ESC calibration on the next restart. Do not adjust this parameter manually.

values.value: Start-up in ESC Calibration mode if throttle high
Start-up in ESC Calibration mode regardless of throttle

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE
param.documentation: Controls which parameters (normally PID gains) are being tuned with transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduCopter:FRAME_TYPE
param.documentation: Controls motor mixing for multicopters. Not used for Tri or Traditional Helicopters.

param.name: ArduCopter:DISARM_DELAY
param.documentation: Delay before automatic disarm in seconds. A value of zero disables auto disarm.

param.name: ArduCopter:ANGLE_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum lean angle in all flight modes

param.name: ArduCopter:PHLD_BRAKE_RATE
param.documentation: PosHold flight mode's rotation rate during braking in deg/sec

param.name: ArduCopter:PHLD_BRAKE_ANGLE
param.documentation: PosHold flight mode's max lean angle during braking in centi-degrees

param.name: ArduCopter:LAND_REPOSITION
param.documentation: Enables user input during LAND mode, the landing phase of RTL, and auto mode landings.

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_EKF_ACTION
param.documentation: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_EKF_THRESH
param.documentation: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_CRASH_CHECK
param.documentation: This enables automatic crash checking. When enabled the motors will disarm if a crash is detected.

param.name: ArduCopter:RC_SPEED
param.documentation: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

param.humanName: Acro Roll and Pitch P gain
param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_RP_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot roll and pitch into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO and SPORT mode. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_YAW_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot yaw input into a desired rate of rotation. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_BAL_ROLL
param.documentation: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro and sport mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster. For helicopter sets the decay rate of the virtual flybar in the roll axis. A higher value causes faster decay of desired to actual attitude.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_BAL_PITCH
param.documentation: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro and sport mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster. For helicopter sets the decay rate of the virtual flybar in the pitch axis. A higher value causes faster decay of desired to actual attitude.

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_TRAINER
param.documentation: Type of trainer used in acro mode

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_RP_EXPO
param.documentation: Acro roll/pitch Expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

param.humanName: Start motors before throwing is detected
param.name: ArduCopter:THROW_MOT_START
param.documentation: Used by Throw mode. Controls whether motors will run at the speed set by MOT_SPIN_MIN or will be stopped when armed and waiting for the throw.

param.name: ArduCopter:WP_NAVALT_MIN
param.documentation: This is the altitude in meters above which for navigation can begin. This applies in auto takeoff and auto landing.

param.name: ArduCopter:THROW_NEXTMODE
param.documentation: Vehicle will switch to this mode after the throw is successfully completed. Default is to stay in throw mode (18)

param.name: ArduCopter:THROW_TYPE
param.documentation: Used by Throw mode. Specifies whether Copter is thrown upward or dropped.

param.name: ArduCopter:GND_EFFECT_COMP
param.documentation: Ground Effect Compensation Enable/Disable

param.name: ArduCopter:DEV_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of developer options. The meanings of the bit fields in this parameter may vary at any time. Developers should check the source code for current meaning

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_Y_EXPO
param.documentation: Acro yaw expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_THR_MID
param.documentation: Acro Throttle Mid

param.name: ArduCopter:SYSID_ENFORCE
param.documentation: This controls whether packets from other than the expected GCS system ID will be accepted

param.name: ArduCopter:FRAME_CLASS
param.documentation: Controls major frame class for multicopter component

param.name: ArduCopter:PILOT_SPEED_DN
param.documentation: The maximum vertical descending velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

param.name: ArduCopter:LAND_ALT_LOW
param.documentation: Altitude during Landing at which vehicle slows to LAND_SPEED

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum value that the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob will be set to

param.name: ArduCopter:TUNE_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum value that the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob will be set to

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_VIBE_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the vibration failsafe which will use modified altitude estimation and control during high vibrations

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of additional options for battery, radio, & GCS failsafes. 0 (default) disables all options.

values.value: Continue if in Auto on RC failsafe only
Continue if in Auto on GCS failsafe only
Continue if in Auto on RC and/or GCS failsafe
Continue if in Guided on RC failsafe only
Continue if landing on any failsafe
Continue if in pilot controlled modes on GCS failsafe
Continue if in Auto on RC and/or GCS failsafe and continue if in pilot controlled modes on GCS failsafe

param.field: 0:Continue if in Auto on RC failsafe, 1:Continue if in Auto on GCS failsafe, 2:Continue if in Guided on RC failsafe, 3:Continue if landing on any failsafe, 4:Continue if in pilot controlled modes on GCS failsafe, 5:Release Gripper

param.name: ArduCopter:ACRO_OPTIONS
param.documentation: A range of options that can be applied to change acro mode behaviour. Air-mode enables ATC_THR_MIX_MAN at all times (air-mode has no effect on helicopters). Rate Loop Only disables the use of angle stabilization and uses angular rate stabilization only.

param.name: ArduCopter:AUTO_OPTIONS
param.documentation: A range of options that can be applied to change auto mode behaviour. Allow Arming allows the copter to be armed in Auto. Allow Takeoff Without Raising Throttle allows takeoff without the pilot having to raise the throttle. Ignore pilot yaw overrides the pilot's yaw stick being used while in auto.
param.field: 0:Allow Arming,1:Allow Takeoff Without Raising Throttle,2:Ignore pilot yaw

param.name: ArduCopter:GUID_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Options that can be applied to change guided mode behaviour

param.name: ArduCopter:FS_GCS_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: Timeout before triggering the GCS failsafe

param.name: ArduCopter:RTL_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Options that can be applied to change RTL mode behaviour

param.name: ArduCopter:FLIGHT_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Flight mode specific options
param.field: 0:Disable thrust loss check, 1:Disable yaw imbalance warning

param.name: ArduCopter:RNGFND_FILT
param.documentation: Rangefinder filter to smooth distance. Set to zero to disable filtering

param.name: ADSB_TYPE
param.documentation: Type of ADS-B hardware for ADSB-in and ADSB-out configuration and operation. If any type is selected then MAVLink based ADSB-in messages will always be enabled

param.name: ADSB_LIST_MAX
param.documentation: ADSB list size of nearest vehicles. Longer lists take longer to refresh with lower SRx_ADSB values.

param.name: ADSB_LIST_RADIUS
param.documentation: ADSB vehicle list radius filter. Vehicles detected outside this radius will be completely ignored. They will not show up in the SRx_ADSB stream to the GCS and will not be considered in any avoidance calculations. A value of 0 will disable this filter.

param.name: ADSB_ICAO_ID
param.documentation: ICAO_ID unique vehicle identification number of this aircraft. This is a integer limited to 24bits. If set to 0 then one will be randomly generated. If set to -1 then static information is not sent, transceiver is assumed pre-programmed.

param.name: ADSB_EMIT_TYPE
param.documentation: ADSB classification for the type of vehicle emitting the transponder signal. Default value is 14 (UAV).

param.name: ADSB_LEN_WIDTH
param.documentation: Aircraft length and width dimension options in Length and Width in meters. In most cases, use a value of 1 for smallest size.

param.name: ADSB_OFFSET_LAT
param.documentation: GPS antenna lateral offset. This describes the physical location offest from center of the GPS antenna on the aircraft.

param.name: ADSB_OFFSET_LON
param.documentation: GPS antenna longitudinal offset. This is usually set to 1, Applied By Sensor

param.name: ADSB_RF_SELECT
param.documentation: Transceiver RF selection for Rx enable and/or Tx enable. This only effects devices that can Tx and/or Rx. Rx-only devices should override this to always be Rx-only.

param.name: ADSB_SQUAWK
param.documentation: VFR squawk (Mode 3/A) code is a pre-programmed default code when the pilot is flying VFR and not in contact with ATC. In the USA, the VFR squawk code is octal 1200 (hex 0x280, decimal 640) and in most parts of Europe the VFR squawk code is octal 7000. If an invalid octal number is set then it will be reset to 1200.

param.name: ADSB_RF_CAPABLE
param.documentation: Describes your hardware RF In/Out capabilities.

param.name: ADSB_LIST_ALT
param.documentation: ADSB vehicle list altitude filter. Vehicles detected above this altitude will be completely ignored. They will not show up in the SRx_ADSB stream to the GCS and will not be considered in any avoidance calculations. A value of 0 will disable this filter.

param.name: ADSB_ICAO_SPECL
param.documentation: ICAO_ID of special vehicle that ignores ADSB_LIST_RADIUS and ADSB_LIST_ALT. The vehicle is always tracked. Use 0 to disable.

param.name: ADSB_LOG
param.documentation: 0: no logging, 1: log only special ID, 2:log all

param.name: AFS_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the advanced failsafe system. If this is set to zero (disable) then all the other AFS options have no effect

param.name: AFS_MAN_PIN
param.documentation: This sets a digital output pin to set high when in manual mode

param.name: AFS_HB_PIN
param.documentation: This sets a digital output pin which is cycled at 10Hz when termination is not activated. Note that if a FS_TERM_PIN is set then the heartbeat pin will continue to cycle at 10Hz when termination is activated, to allow the termination board to distinguish between autopilot crash and termination.

param.name: AFS_WP_COMMS
param.documentation: Waypoint number to navigate to on comms loss

param.name: AFS_WP_GPS_LOSS
param.documentation: Waypoint number to navigate to on GPS lock loss

param.name: AFS_TERMINATE
param.documentation: Can be set in flight to force termination of the heartbeat signal

param.name: AFS_TERM_ACTION
param.documentation: This can be used to force an action on flight termination. Normally this is handled by an external failsafe board, but you can setup ArduPilot to handle it here. Please consult the wiki for more information on the possible values of the parameter

param.name: AFS_TERM_PIN
param.documentation: This sets a digital output pin to set high on flight termination

param.name: AFS_AMSL_LIMIT
param.documentation: This sets the AMSL (above mean sea level) altitude limit. If the pressure altitude determined by QNH exceeds this limit then flight termination will be forced. Note that this limit is in meters, whereas pressure altitude limits are often quoted in feet. A value of zero disables the pressure altitude limit.

param.humanName: Error margin for GPS based AMSL limit
param.name: AFS_AMSL_ERR_GPS
param.documentation: This sets margin for error in GPS derived altitude limit. This error margin is only used if the barometer has failed. If the barometer fails then the GPS will be used to enforce the AMSL_LIMIT, but this margin will be subtracted from the AMSL_LIMIT first, to ensure that even with the given amount of GPS altitude error the pressure altitude is not breached. OBC users should set this to comply with their D2 safety case. A value of -1 will mean that barometer failure will lead to immediate termination.

param.name: AFS_QNH_PRESSURE
param.documentation: This sets the QNH pressure in millibars to be used for pressure altitude in the altitude limit. A value of zero disables the altitude limit.

param.humanName: Maximum number of GPS loss events
param.name: AFS_MAX_GPS_LOSS
param.documentation: Maximum number of GPS loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on GPS recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of GPS loss events.

param.humanName: Maximum number of comms loss events
param.name: AFS_MAX_COM_LOSS
param.documentation: Maximum number of comms loss events before the aircraft stops returning to mission on comms recovery. Use zero to allow for any number of comms loss events.

param.name: AFS_GEOFENCE
param.documentation: This enables the geofence part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

param.name: AFS_RC
param.documentation: This enables the RC part of the AFS. Will only be in effect if AFS_ENABLE is also 1

param.humanName: Enable RC Termination only in manual control modes
param.name: AFS_RC_MAN_ONLY
param.documentation: If this parameter is set to 1, then an RC loss will only cause the plane to terminate in manual control modes. If it is 0, then the plane will terminate in any flight mode.

param.humanName: Enable dual loss terminate due to failure of both GCS and GPS simultaneously
param.name: AFS_DUAL_LOSS
param.documentation: This enables the dual loss termination part of the AFS system. If this parameter is 1 and both GPS and the ground control station fail simultaneously, this will be considered a "dual loss" and cause termination.

param.name: AFS_RC_FAIL_TIME
param.documentation: This is the time in seconds in manual mode that failsafe termination will activate if RC input is lost. For the OBC rules this should be (1.5). Use 0 to disable.

param.name: AFS_MAX_RANGE
param.documentation: This is the maximum range of the vehicle in kilometers from first arming. If the vehicle goes beyond this range then the TERM_ACTION is performed. A value of zero disables this feature.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight. Currently this affects only the DCM-based AHRS: the EKF uses GPS whenever it is available.

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is. See ARSPD_OPTIONS and ARSPD_MAX_WIND to disable airspeed sensors.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.humanName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
param.name: AHRS_EKF_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls which NavEKF Kalman filter version is used for attitude and position estimation

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_ROLL
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position roll offset. Positive values = roll right, negative values = roll left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_PIT
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position pitch offset. Positive values = pitch up, negative values = pitch down. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: AHRS_CUSTOM_YAW
param.documentation: Autopilot mounting position yaw offset. Positive values = yaw right, negative values = yaw left. This parameter is only used when AHRS_ORIENTATION is set to CUSTOM.

param.name: ARMING_ACCTHRESH
param.documentation: Accelerometer error threshold used to determine inconsistent accelerometers. Compares this error range to other accelerometers to detect a hardware or calibration error. Lower value means tighter check and harder to pass arming check. Not all accelerometers are created equal.

param.name: ARMING_RUDDER
param.documentation: Allow arm/disarm by rudder input. When enabled arming can be done with right rudder, disarming with left rudder. Rudder arming only works in manual throttle modes with throttle at zero +- deadzone (RCx_DZ)

param.name: ARMING_MIS_ITEMS
param.documentation: Bitmask of mission items that are required to be planned in order to arm the aircraft

param.name: ARMING_CHECK
param.documentation: Checks prior to arming motor. This is a bitmask of checks that will be performed before allowing arming. For most users it is recommended to leave this at the default of 1 (all checks enabled). You can select whatever checks you prefer by adding together the values of each check type to set this parameter. For example, to only allow arming when you have GPS lock and no RC failsafe you would set ARMING_CHECK to 72.
param.field: 0:All,1:Barometer,2:Compass,3:GPS lock,4:INS,5:Parameters,6:RC Channels,7:Board voltage,8:Battery Level,10:Logging Available,11:Hardware safety switch,12:GPS Configuration,13:System,14:Mission,15:Rangefinder,16:Camera,17:AuxAuth,18:VisualOdometry,19:FFT

param.name: AROT_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the autonomous autorotation capability.

param.humanName: P gain for head speed controller
param.name: AROT_HS_P
param.documentation: Increase value to increase sensitivity of head speed controller during autonomous autorotation.

param.name: AROT_HS_SET_PT
param.documentation: The target head speed in RPM during autorotation. Start by setting to desired hover speed and tune from there as necessary.

param.name: AROT_TARG_SP
param.documentation: Target ground speed in cm/s for the autorotation controller to try and achieve/ maintain during the glide phase.

param.name: AROT_COL_FILT_E
param.documentation: Cut-off frequency for collective low pass filter. For the entry phase. Acts as a following trim. Must be higher than AROT_COL_FILT_G.

param.name: AROT_COL_FILT_G
param.documentation: Cut-off frequency for collective low pass filter. For the glide phase. Acts as a following trim. Must be lower than AROT_COL_FILT_E.

param.name: AROT_AS_ACC_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum forward acceleration to apply in speed controller.

param.name: AROT_BAIL_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds from bail out initiated to the exit of autorotation flight mode.

param.name: AROT_HS_SENSOR
param.documentation: Allocate the RPM sensor instance to use for measuring head speed. RPM1 = 0. RPM2 = 1.

param.name: AROT_FW_V_P
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Determines the propotion of the target acceleration based on the velocity error.

param.name: AROT_FW_V_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. Corrects the target acceleration proportionally to the desired velocity.

param.name: ATC_SLEW_YAW
param.documentation: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

param.name: ATC_ACCEL_Y_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum acceleration in yaw axis

param.name: ATC_RATE_FF_ENAB
param.documentation: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

param.name: ATC_ACCEL_R_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum acceleration in roll axis

param.name: ATC_ACCEL_P_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum acceleration in pitch axis

param.name: ATC_ANGLE_BOOST
param.documentation: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

param.humanName: Roll axis angle controller P gain
param.name: ATC_ANG_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis angle controller P gain
param.name: ATC_ANG_PIT_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired pitch angle and actual angle to a desired pitch rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis angle controller P gain
param.name: ATC_ANG_YAW_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

param.humanName: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant
param.name: ATC_ANG_LIM_TC
param.documentation: Angle Limit (to maintain altitude) Time Constant

param.name: ATC_RATE_R_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum angular velocity in roll axis

param.name: ATC_RATE_P_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum angular velocity in pitch axis

param.name: ATC_RATE_Y_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum angular velocity in yaw axis

param.name: ATC_INPUT_TC
param.documentation: Attitude control input time constant. Low numbers lead to sharper response, higher numbers to softer response

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller P gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_I
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_D
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller feed forward
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FF
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller feed forward

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTT
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTE
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FLTD
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain

param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_RAT_PIT_FLTD
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: ATC_THR_MIX_MIN
param.documentation: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used when landing (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

param.name: ATC_THR_MIX_MAX
param.documentation: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during active flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

param.name: ATC_THR_MIX_MAN
param.documentation: Throttle vs attitude control prioritisation used during manual flight (higher values mean we prioritise attitude control over throttle)

param.name: ATC_HOVR_ROL_TRM
param.documentation: Trim the hover roll angle to counter tail rotor thrust in a hover

param.name: ATC_PIRO_COMP
param.documentation: Pirouette compensation enabled

param.name: AUTOTUNE_AXES
param.documentation: 1-byte bitmap of axes to autotune

param.name: AUTOTUNE_AGGR
param.documentation: Autotune aggressiveness. Defines the bounce back used to detect size of the D term.

param.name: AUTOTUNE_MIN_D
param.documentation: Defines the minimum D gain

param.name: AVD_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable Avoidance using ADSB

param.name: AVD_F_ACTION
param.documentation: Specifies aircraft behaviour when a collision is imminent

param.name: AVD_W_ACTION
param.documentation: Specifies aircraft behaviour when a collision may occur

param.humanName: Recovery behaviour after a fail event
param.name: AVD_F_RCVRY
param.documentation: Determines what the aircraft will do after a fail event is resolved

param.humanName: Maximum number of obstacles to track
param.name: AVD_OBS_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum number of obstacles to track

param.name: AVD_W_TIME
param.documentation: Aircraft velocity vectors are multiplied by this time to determine closest approach. If this results in an approach closer than W_DIST_XY or W_DIST_Z then W_ACTION is undertaken (assuming F_ACTION is not undertaken)

param.name: AVD_F_TIME
param.documentation: Aircraft velocity vectors are multiplied by this time to determine closest approach. If this results in an approach closer than F_DIST_XY or F_DIST_Z then F_ACTION is undertaken

param.name: AVD_W_DIST_XY
param.documentation: Closest allowed projected distance before W_ACTION is undertaken

param.name: AVD_F_DIST_XY
param.documentation: Closest allowed projected distance before F_ACTION is undertaken

param.name: AVD_W_DIST_Z
param.documentation: Closest allowed projected distance before BEHAVIOUR_W is undertaken

param.name: AVD_F_DIST_Z
param.documentation: Closest allowed projected distance before BEHAVIOUR_F is undertaken

param.name: AVD_F_ALT_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum AMSL (above mean sea level) altitude for ADS-B avoidance. If the vehicle is below this altitude, no avoidance action will take place. Useful to prevent ADS-B avoidance from activating while below the tree line or around structures. Default of 0 is no minimum.

param.name: AVOID_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enabled/disable avoidance input sources

param.humanName: Avoidance max lean angle in non-GPS flight modes
param.name: AVOID_ANGLE_MAX
param.documentation: Max lean angle used to avoid obstacles while in non-GPS modes

param.humanName: Avoidance distance maximum in non-GPS flight modes
param.name: AVOID_DIST_MAX
param.documentation: Distance from object at which obstacle avoidance will begin in non-GPS modes

param.humanName: Avoidance distance margin in GPS modes
param.name: AVOID_MARGIN
param.documentation: Vehicle will attempt to stay at least this distance (in meters) from objects while in GPS modes

param.name: AVOID_BEHAVE
param.documentation: Avoidance behaviour (slide or stop)

param.name: AVOID_BACKUP_SPD
param.documentation: Maximum speed that will be used to back away from obstacles in GPS modes (m/s). Set zero to disable

param.name: AVOID_ALT_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum altitude above which proximity based avoidance will start working. This requires a valid downward facing rangefinder reading to work. Set zero to disable

param.name: AVOID_ACCEL_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum acceleration with which obstacles will be avoided with. Set zero to disable acceleration limits

param.humanName: Avoidance deadzone between stopping and backing away from obstacle
param.name: AVOID_BACKUP_DZ
param.documentation: Distance beyond AVOID_MARGIN parameter, after which vehicle will backaway from obstacles. Increase this parameter if you see vehicle going back and forth in front of obstacle.

param.name: BARO1_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: BARO_GND_TEMP
param.documentation: User provided ambient ground temperature in degrees Celsius. This is used to improve the calculation of the altitude the vehicle is at. This parameter is not persistent and will be reset to 0 every time the vehicle is rebooted. A value of 0 means use the internal measurement ambient temperature.

param.name: BARO_ALT_OFFSET
param.documentation: altitude offset in meters added to barometric altitude. This is used to allow for automatic adjustment of the base barometric altitude by a ground station equipped with a barometer. The value is added to the barometric altitude read by the aircraft. It is automatically reset to 0 when the barometer is calibrated on each reboot or when a preflight calibration is performed.

param.name: BARO_PRIMARY
param.documentation: This selects which barometer will be the primary if multiple barometers are found

param.name: BARO_EXT_BUS
param.documentation: This selects the bus number for looking for an I2C barometer. When set to -1 it will probe all external i2c buses based on the GND_PROBE_EXT parameter.

param.name: BARO_SPEC_GRAV
param.documentation: This sets the specific gravity of the fluid when flying an underwater ROV.

param.name: BARO2_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.name: BARO3_GND_PRESS
param.documentation: calibrated ground pressure in Pascals

param.humanName: Range in which sample is accepted
param.name: BARO_FLTR_RNG
param.documentation: This sets the range around the average value that new samples must be within to be accepted. This can help reduce the impact of noise on sensors that are on long I2C cables. The value is a percentage from the average value. A value of zero disables this filter.

param.name: BARO_PROBE_EXT
param.documentation: This sets which types of external i2c barometer to look for. It is a bitmask of barometer types. The I2C buses to probe is based on GND_EXT_BUS. If BARO_EXT_BUS is -1 then it will probe all external buses, otherwise it will probe just the bus number given in GND_EXT_BUS.

param.name: BARO1_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO2_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO3_DEVID
param.documentation: Barometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: BARO1_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative X direction (backwards)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_BCK
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during backwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive Y direction (right)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_RGT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in negative Y direction (left)
param.name: BARO1_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BARO2_WCF_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO2_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BARO2_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.documentation: This enables the use of wind coefficients for barometer compensation

param.humanName: Pressure error coefficient in positive X direction (forward)
param.name: BARO3_WCF_FWD
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the X body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during forwards flight, then this will be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a positive wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the right, then this should be a negative number. Multirotors can use this feature only if using EKF3 and if the EK3_BCOEF_X and EK3_BCOEF_Y parameters have been tuned.

param.name: BARO3_WCF_LFT
param.documentation: This is the ratio of static pressure error to dynamic pressure generated by a negative wind relative velocity along the Y body axis. If the baro height estimate rises during sideways flight to the left, then this should be a negative number. param.name: BATT2_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT2_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT2_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT2_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

param.name: BATT2_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT2_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT2_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With UAVCAN it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT2_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT2_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT2_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT2__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT2_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT2_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT2_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT2__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT2_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT2_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

param.name: BATT3_MONITOR
param.documentation: Controls enabling monitoring of the battery's voltage and current

param.name: BATT3_VOLT_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for voltage monitoring.

param.name: BATT3_CURR_PIN
param.documentation: Sets the analog input pin that should be used for current monitoring.

param.name: BATT3_VOLT_MULT
param.documentation: Used to convert the voltage of the voltage sensing pin (BATT3_VOLT_PIN) to the actual battery's voltage (pin_voltage * VOLT_MULT). For the 3DR Power brick with a Pixhawk, this should be set to 10.1. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 12.02. For the PX using the PX4IO power supply this should be set to 1.

param.name: BATT3_AMP_PERVLT
param.documentation: Number of amps that a 1V reading on the current sensor corresponds to. With a Pixhawk using the 3DR Power brick this should be set to 17. For the Pixhawk with the 3DR 4in1 ESC this should be 17.

param.name: BATT3_AMP_OFFSET
param.documentation: Voltage offset at zero current on current sensor

param.name: BATT3_CAPACITY
param.documentation: Capacity of the battery in mAh when full

param.name: BATT3_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: Battery serial number, automatically filled in for SMBus batteries, otherwise will be -1. With UAVCAN it is the battery_id.

param.name: BATT3_LOW_TIMER
param.documentation: This is the timeout in seconds before a low voltage event will be triggered. For aircraft with low C batteries it may be necessary to raise this in order to cope with low voltage on long takeoffs. A value of zero disables low voltage errors.

param.name: BATT3_FS_VOLTSRC
param.documentation: Voltage type used for detection of low voltage event

param.name: BATT3_LOW_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a low battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT3_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT3_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT3_LOW_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the low battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT3_FS_LOW_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT3_CRT_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage that triggers a critical battery failsafe. Set to 0 to disable. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage continuously for more then the period specified by the BATT3_LOW_TIMER parameter then the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT3_FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT3_CRT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity at which the critical battery failsafe is triggered. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery capacity drops below this level the vehicle will perform the failsafe specified by the BATT3__FS_CRT_ACT parameter.

param.name: BATT3_FS_LOW_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a low battery failsafe

param.name: BATT3_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT3_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT3_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT3__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT_FS_CRT_ACT
param.documentation: What action the vehicle should perform if it hits a critical battery failsafe

param.name: BATT_ARM_VOLT
param.documentation: Battery voltage level which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any voltage.

param.name: BATT_ARM_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining which is required to arm the aircraft. Set to 0 to allow arming at any capacity. Note that execept for smart batteries rebooting the vehicle will always reset the remaining capacity estimate, which can lead to this check not providing sufficent protection, it is recommended to always use this in conjunction with the BATT__ARM_VOLT parameter.

param.name: BATT_BUS
param.documentation: Battery monitor I2C bus number

param.name: BATT_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options to change the behaviour of the battery monitor

param.humanName: Beacon based position estimation device type
param.name: BCN_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of beacon based position estimation device is connected

param.name: BCN_LATITUDE
param.documentation: Beacon origin's latitude

param.name: BCN_LONGITUDE
param.documentation: Beacon origin's longitude

param.humanName: Beacon origin's altitude above sealevel in meters
param.name: BCN_ALT
param.documentation: Beacon origin's altitude above sealevel in meters

param.humanName: Beacon systems rotation from north in degrees
param.name: BCN_ORIENT_YAW
param.documentation: Beacon systems rotation from north in degrees

param.name: BRD_PWM_COUNT
param.documentation: Controls number of FMU outputs which are setup for PWM. All unassigned pins can be used for GPIO

param.name: BRD_SER1_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 1 (telemetry 1) on Pixhawk. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup. Note that the PX4v1 does not have hardware flow control pins on this port, so you should leave this disabled.

param.name: BRD_SER2_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 2 (telemetry 2) on Pixhawk and STATE. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER3_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 3. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER4_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 4. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.name: BRD_SER5_RTSCTS
param.documentation: Enable flow control on serial 5. You must have the RTS and CTS pins connected to your radio. The standard DF13 6 pin connector for a 3DR radio does have those pins connected. If this is set to 2 then flow control will be auto-detected by checking for the output buffer filling on startup.

param.humanName: Enable use of safety arming switch
param.name: BRD_SAFETYENABLE
param.documentation: This controls the default state of the safety switch at startup. When set to 1 the safety switch will start in the safe state (flashing) at boot. When set to zero the safety switch will start in the unsafe state (solid) at startup. Note that if a safety switch is fitted the user can still control the safety state after startup using the switch. The safety state can also be controlled in software using a MAVLink message.

param.name: BRD_SBUS_OUT
param.documentation: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz

param.name: BRD_SERIAL_NUM
param.documentation: User-defined serial number of this vehicle, it can be any arbitrary number you want and has no effect on the autopilot

param.humanName: Outputs which ignore the safety switch state
param.name: BRD_SAFETY_MASK
param.documentation: A bitmask which controls what outputs can move while the safety switch has not been pressed

param.name: BRD_IMU_TARGTEMP
param.documentation: This sets the target IMU temperature for boards with controllable IMU heating units. DO NOT SET to -1 on the Cube. Set to -1 to disable the heater, please reboot after setting to -1.

param.name: BRD_TYPE
param.documentation: This allows selection of a PX4 or VRBRAIN board type. If set to zero then the board type is auto-detected (PX4)

param.name: BRD_IO_ENABLE
param.documentation: This allows for the IO co-processor on FMUv1 and FMUv2 to be disabled

param.name: BRD_SAFETYOPTION
param.documentation: This controls the activation of the safety button. It allows you to control if the safety button can be used for safety enable and/or disable, and whether the button is only active when disarmed
param.field: 0:ActiveForSafetyEnable,1:ActiveForSafetyDisable,2:ActiveWhenArmed,3:Force safety on when the aircraft disarms

param.name: BRD_VBUS_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum voltage on the autopilot power rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

param.name: BRD_VSERVO_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum voltage on the servo rail to allow the aircraft to arm. 0 to disable the check.

param.name: BRD_SD_SLOWDOWN
param.documentation: This is a scaling factor to slow down microSD operation. It can be used on flight board and microSD card combinations where full speed is not reliable. For normal full speed operation a value of 0 should be used.

param.name: BRD_PWM_VOLT_SEL
param.documentation: This sets the voltage max for PWM output pulses. 0 for 3.3V and 1 for 5V output.

param.name: BRD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Board specific option flags
param.field: 0:Enable hardware watchdog, 1:Disable MAVftp, 2:Enable set of internal parameters

param.name: BRD_BOOT_DELAY
param.documentation: This adds a delay in milliseconds to boot to ensure peripherals initialise fully

param.name: BRD_IMUHEAT_P
param.documentation: IMU Heater P gain

param.name: BRD_IMUHEAT_I
param.documentation: IMU Heater integrator gain

param.name: BRD_IMUHEAT_IMAX
param.documentation: IMU Heater integrator maximum

param.name: BRD_ALT_CONFIG
param.documentation: Select an alternative hardware configuration. A value of zero selects the default configuration for this board. Other values are board specific. Please see the documentation for your board for details on any alternative configuration values that may be available.

param.humanName: Set type of direct attached radio
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TYPE
param.documentation: This enables support for direct attached radio receivers

param.name: BRD_RADIO_PROT
param.documentation: Select air protocol

param.name: BRD_RADIO_DEBUG
param.documentation: radio debug level

param.name: BRD_RADIO_DISCRC
param.documentation: disable receive CRC (for debug)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_SIGCH
param.documentation: Channel to show receive RSSI signal strength, or zero for disabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_PPSCH
param.documentation: Channel to show received packet-per-second rate, or zero for disabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TELEM
param.documentation: If this is non-zero then telemetry packets will be sent over DSM

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TXPOW
param.documentation: Set telemetry transmit power. This is the power level (from 1 to 8) for telemetry packets sent from the RX to the TX

param.humanName: Put radio into FCC test mode
param.name: BRD_RADIO_FCCTST
param.documentation: If this is enabled then the radio will continuously transmit as required for FCC testing. The transmit channel is set by the value of the parameter. The radio will not work for RC input while this is enabled

param.name: BRD_RADIO_STKMD
param.documentation: This selects between different stick input modes. The default is mode2, which has throttle on the left stick and pitch on the right stick. You can instead set mode1, which has throttle on the right stick and pitch on the left stick.

param.humanName: Set radio to factory test channel
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TESTCH
param.documentation: This sets the radio to a fixed test channel for factory testing. Using a fixed channel avoids the need for binding in factory testing.

param.humanName: RSSI value channel for telemetry data on transmitter
param.name: BRD_RADIO_TSIGCH
param.documentation: Channel to show telemetry RSSI value as received by TX

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TPPSCH
param.documentation: Channel to show telemetry packets-per-second value, as received at TX

param.name: BRD_RADIO_TXMAX
param.documentation: Set transmitter maximum transmit power (from 1 to 8)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_BZOFS
param.documentation: Set transmitter buzzer note adjustment (adjust frequency up)

param.name: BRD_RADIO_ABTIME
param.documentation: When non-zero this sets the time with no transmitter packets before we start looking for auto-bind packets.

param.name: BRD_RADIO_ABLVL
param.documentation: This sets the minimum RSSI of an auto-bind packet for it to be accepted. This should be set so that auto-bind will only happen at short range to minimise the change of an auto-bind happening accidentially

param.name: BRD_RTC_TYPES
param.documentation: Specifies which sources of UTC time will be accepted

param.name: BRD_RTC_TZ_MIN
param.documentation: Adds offset in +- minutes from UTC to calculate local time

param.name: BTN_ENABLE
param.documentation: This enables the button checking module. When this is disabled the parameters for setting button inputs are not visible

param.name: BTN_PIN1
param.documentation: Digital pin number for first button input.

param.name: BTN_PIN2
param.documentation: Digital pin number for second button input.

param.name: BTN_PIN3
param.documentation: Digital pin number for third button input.

param.name: BTN_PIN4
param.documentation: Digital pin number for fourth button input.

param.name: BTN_REPORT_SEND
param.documentation: The duration in seconds that a BUTTON_CHANGE report is repeatedly sent to the GCS regarding a button changing state. Note that the BUTTON_CHANGE message is MAVLink2 only.

param.name: BTN_OPTIONS1
param.documentation: Options for Pin 1. PWM input detects PWM above or below 1800/1200us instead of logic level. Invert changes HIGH state to be logic low voltage on pin, or below 1200us, if PWM input.

param.name: BTN_OPTIONS2
param.documentation: Options for Pin 2. PWM input detects PWM above or below 1800/1200us instead of logic level. Invert changes HIGH state to be logic low voltage on pin, or below 1200us, if PWM input.

param.name: BTN_OPTIONS3
param.documentation: Options for Pin 3. PWM input detects PWM above or below 1800/1200us instead of logic level. Invert changes HIGH state to be logic low voltage on pin, or below 1200us, if PWM input.

param.name: BTN_OPTIONS4
param.documentation: Options for Pin 4. PWM input detects PWM above or below 1800/1200us instead of logic level. Invert changes HIGH state to be logic low voltage on pin, or below 1200us, if PWM input.

param.name: BTN_FUNC1
param.documentation: Auxiliary RC Options function executed on pin change

param.name: BTN_FUNC2
param.documentation: Auxiliary RC Options function executed on pin change

param.name: BTN_FUNC3
param.documentation: Auxiliary RC Options function executed on pin change

param.name: BTN_FUNC4
param.documentation: Auxiliary RC Options function executed on pin change

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_TYPE
param.documentation: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

param.humanName: Duration that shutter is held open
param.name: CAM_DURATION
param.documentation: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

param.name: CAM_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is activated

param.name: CAM_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: PWM value in microseconds to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_DIST
param.documentation: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

param.name: CAM_RELAY_ON
param.documentation: This sets whether the relay goes high or low when it triggers. Note that you should also set RELAY_DEFAULT appropriately for your camera

param.name: CAM_MIN_INTERVAL
param.documentation: Postpone shooting if previous picture was taken less than preset time(ms) ago.

param.name: CAM_MAX_ROLL
param.documentation: Postpone shooting if roll is greater than limit. (0=Disable, will shoot regardless of roll).

param.name: CAM_FEEDBACK_PIN
param.documentation: pin number to use for save accurate camera feedback messages. If set to -1 then don't use a pin flag for this, otherwise this is a pin number which if held high after a picture trigger order, will save camera messages when camera really takes a picture. A universal camera hot shoe is needed. The pin should be held high for at least 2 milliseconds for reliable trigger detection. See also the CAM_FEEDBACK_POL option.

param.name: CAM_FEEDBACK_POL
param.documentation: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the feedback pin should go high on trigger. If set to 0 then it should go low

param.name: CAM_AUTO_ONLY
param.documentation: When enabled, trigging by distance is done in AUTO mode only.

param.name: CAM_TYPE
param.documentation: Set the camera type that is being used, certain cameras have custom functions that need further configuration, this enables that.

param.name: CAM_RC_TYPE
param.documentation: RunCam deviee type used to determine OSD menu structure and shutter options.

param.name: CAM_RC_FEATURES
param.documentation: The available features of the attached RunCam device. If 0 then the RunCam device will be queried for the features it supports, otherwise this setting is used.
param.field: 0:Power Button,1:WiFi Button,2:Change Mode,3:5-Key OSD,4:Settings Access,5:DisplayPort,6:Start Recording,7:Stop Recording

param.humanName: RunCam boot delay before allowing updates
param.name: CAM_RC_BT_DELAY
param.documentation: Time it takes for the RunCam to become fully ready in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

param.humanName: RunCam button delay before allowing further button presses
param.name: CAM_RC_BTN_DELAY
param.documentation: Time it takes for the a RunCam button press to be actived in ms. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

param.humanName: RunCam mode delay before allowing further button presses
param.name: CAM_RC_MDE_DELAY
param.documentation: Time it takes for the a RunCam mode button press to be actived in ms. If a mode change first requires a video recording change then double this value is used. If this is too short then commands can get out of sync.

param.name: CAM_RC_CONTROL
param.documentation: Specifies the allowed actions required to enter the OSD menu
param.field: 0:Stick yaw right,1:Stick roll right,2:3-position switch,3:2-position switch,4:Autorecording enabled

param.name: CAN_LOGLEVEL
param.documentation: Loglevel for recording initialisation and debug information from CAN Interface

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D1_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.name: CAN_D1_KDE_NPOLE
param.documentation: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_ESC_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ESC command messages

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16

param.name: CAN_D1_PC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of servo command messages

param.name: CAN_D1_TST_ID
param.documentation: Selects the Index of Test that needs to be run recursively, this value gets reset to 0 at boot.

param.name: CAN_D1_TST_LPR8
param.documentation: Selects the Looprate of Test methods

param.humanName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_NODE
param.documentation: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D1_UC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

param.name: CAN_D1_UC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D2_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.name: CAN_D2_KDE_NPOLE
param.documentation: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

param.name: CAN_D2_PC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

param.name: CAN_D2_PC_ESC_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ESC command messages

param.name: CAN_D2_PC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16

param.name: CAN_D2_PC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of servo command messages

param.name: CAN_D2_TST_ID
param.documentation: Selects the Index of Test that needs to be run recursively, this value gets reset to 0 at boot.

param.name: CAN_D2_TST_LPR8
param.documentation: Selects the Looprate of Test methods

param.humanName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
param.name: CAN_D2_UC_NODE
param.documentation: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D2_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D2_UC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

param.name: CAN_D2_UC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

param.humanName: Enable use of specific protocol over virtual driver
param.name: CAN_D3_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Enabling this option starts selected protocol that will use this virtual driver

param.name: CAN_D3_KDE_NPOLE
param.documentation: Sets the number of motor poles to calculate the correct RPM value

param.name: CAN_D3_PC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which ESC (motor) channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN

param.name: CAN_D3_PC_ESC_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of ESC command messages

param.name: CAN_D3_PC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask defining which servo channels are to be transmitted over Piccolo CAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15, 15: Servo 16

param.name: CAN_D3_PC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Output rate of servo command messages

param.name: CAN_D3_TST_ID
param.documentation: Selects the Index of Test that needs to be run recursively, this value gets reset to 0 at boot.

param.name: CAN_D3_TST_LPR8
param.documentation: Selects the Looprate of Test methods

param.humanName: UAVCAN node that is used for this network
param.name: CAN_D3_UC_NODE
param.documentation: UAVCAN node should be set implicitly

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as servo over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D3_UC_SRV_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a servo command over UAVCAN
param.field: 0: Servo 1, 1: Servo 2, 2: Servo 3, 3: Servo 4, 4: Servo 5, 5: Servo 6, 6: Servo 7, 7: Servo 8, 8: Servo 9, 9: Servo 10, 10: Servo 11, 11: Servo 12, 12: Servo 13, 13: Servo 14, 14: Servo 15

param.humanName: RC Out channels to be transmitted as ESC over UAVCAN
param.name: CAN_D3_UC_ESC_BM
param.documentation: Bitmask with one set for channel to be transmitted as a ESC command over UAVCAN

param.name: CAN_D3_UC_SRV_RT
param.documentation: Maximum transmit rate for servo outputs

param.humanName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
param.name: CAN_P1_DRIVER
param.documentation: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

param.name: CAN_P1_BITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.humanName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
param.name: CAN_P2_DRIVER
param.documentation: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

param.name: CAN_P2_BITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.humanName: Index of virtual driver to be used with physical CAN interface
param.name: CAN_P3_DRIVER
param.documentation: Enabling this option enables use of CAN buses.

param.name: CAN_P3_BITRATE
param.documentation: Bit rate can be set up to from 10000 to 1000000

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_CPORT
param.documentation: CAN Interface ID to be routed to SLCAN, 0 means no routing

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_SERNUM
param.documentation: Serial Port ID to be used for temporary SLCAN iface, -1 means no temporary serial. This parameter is automatically reset on reboot or on timeout. See CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT for timeout details

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_TIMOUT
param.documentation: Duration of inactivity after which SLCAN is switched back to original driver in seconds.

param.name: CAN_SLCAN_SDELAY
param.documentation: Duration after which slcan starts after setting SERNUM in seconds.

param.name: CHUTE_ENABLED
param.documentation: Parachute release enabled or disabled

param.humanName: Parachute release mechanism type (relay or servo)
param.name: CHUTE_TYPE
param.documentation: Parachute release mechanism type (relay or servo)

param.name: CHUTE_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: Parachute Servo PWM value in microseconds when parachute is released

param.name: CHUTE_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: Parachute Servo PWM value in microseconds when parachute is not released

param.humanName: Parachute min altitude in meters above home
param.name: CHUTE_ALT_MIN
param.documentation: Parachute min altitude above home. Parachute will not be released below this altitude. 0 to disable alt check.

param.name: CHUTE_DELAY_MS
param.documentation: Delay in millseconds between motor stop and chute release

param.humanName: Critical sink speed rate in m/s to trigger emergency parachute
param.name: CHUTE_CRT_SINK
param.documentation: Release parachute when critical sink rate is reached

param.name: CIRCLE_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the radius of the circle the vehicle will fly when in Circle flight mode

param.name: CIRCLE_RATE
param.documentation: Circle mode's turn rate in deg/sec. Positive to turn clockwise, negative for counter clockwise

param.name: CIRCLE_OPTIONS
param.documentation: 0:Enable or disable using the pitch/roll stick control circle mode's radius and rate
param.field: 0:manual control, 1:face direction of travel, 2:Start at center rather than on perimeter

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle. If InFlight learning is enabled then the compass with automatically start learning once a flight starts (must be armed). While InFlight learning is running you cannot use position control modes.

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference (Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle)

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT
param.documentation: The orientation of the first external compass relative to the vehicle frame. This value will be ignored unless this compass is set as an external compass. When set correctly in the northern hemisphere, pointing the nose and right side down should increase the MagX and MagY values respectively. Rolling the vehicle upside down should decrease the MagZ value. For southern hemisphere, switch increase and decrease. NOTE: For internal compasses, AHRS_ORIENT is used.

param.humanName: Compass is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERNAL
param.documentation: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame
