Leveling the swashplate can only be done through the pitch links. See the ardupilot wiki for more details on setup.

param.name: H_SW_H3_ENABLE
param.documentation: Automatically set when H3 generic swash type is selected for swashplate 1. Do not set manually.

param.name: H_SW_H3_SV1_POS
param.documentation: Azimuth position on swashplate for servo 1 with the front of the heli being 0 deg

param.name: H_SW_H3_SV2_POS
param.documentation: Azimuth position on swashplate 1 for servo 2 with the front of the heli being 0 deg

param.name: H_SW_H3_SV3_POS
param.documentation: Azimuth position on swashplate 1 for servo 3 with the front of the heli being 0 deg

param.humanName: Swash 1 H3 Generic Phase Angle Comp
param.name: H_SW_H3_PHANG
param.documentation: Only for H3 swashplate. If pitching the swash forward induces a roll, this can be correct the problem

param.name: H_SW2_TYPE
param.documentation: H3 is generic, three-servo only. H3_120/H3_140 plates have Motor1 left side, Motor2 right side, Motor3 elevator in rear. HR3_120/HR3_140 have Motor1 right side, Motor2 left side, Motor3 elevator in front - use H3_120/H3_140 and reverse servo and collective directions as necessary. For all H3_90 swashplates use H4_90 and don't use servo output for the missing servo. For H4-90 Motors1&2 are left/right respectively, Motors3&4 are rear/front respectively. For H4-45 Motors1&2 are LF/RF, Motors3&4 are LR/RR

param.name: H_SW2_COL_DIR
param.documentation: Direction collective moves for positive pitch. 0 for Normal, 1 for Reversed

param.name: H_SW2_LIN_SVO
param.documentation: This linearizes the swashplate 2 servo's mechanical output to account for nonlinear output due to arm rotation. This requires a specific setup procedure to work properly. The servo arm must be centered on the mechanical throw at the servo trim position and the servo trim position kept as close to 1500 as possible. Leveling the swashplate can only be done through the pitch links. See the ardupilot wiki for more details on setup.

param.name: H_SW2_H3_ENABLE
param.documentation: Automatically set when H3 generic swash type is selected for swashplate 2. Do not set manually.

param.name: H_SW2_H3_SV1_POS
param.documentation: Azimuth position on swashplate for servo 1 with the front of the heli being 0 deg

param.name: H_SW2_H3_SV2_POS
param.documentation: Azimuth position on swashplate 2 for servo 2 with the front of the heli being 0 deg

param.name: H_SW2_H3_SV3_POS
param.documentation: Azimuth position on swashplate 2 for servo 3 with the front of the heli being 0 deg

param.humanName: Swash 2 H3 Generic Phase Angle Comp
param.name: H_SW2_H3_PHANG
param.documentation: Only for H3 swashplate. If pitching the swash forward induces a roll, this can be correct the problem

param.name: H_DCP_TRIM
param.documentation: Removes I term bias due to center of gravity offsets or discrepancies between rotors in swashplate setup. If DCP axis has I term bias while hovering in calm winds, use value of bias in DCP_TRIM to re-center I term.

param.name: H_YAW_REV_EXPO
param.documentation: For intermeshing mode only. Yaw revereser smoothing exponent, smoothen transition near zero collective region. Increase this parameter to shink smoothing range. Set to -1 to disable reverser.

param.name: H_COL_MIN
param.documentation: Lowest possible servo position in PWM microseconds for the swashplate

param.name: H_COL_MAX
param.documentation: Highest possible servo position in PWM microseconds for the swashplate

param.name: H_COL_MID
param.documentation: Swash servo position in PWM microseconds corresponding to zero collective pitch (or zero lift for Asymmetrical blades)

param.name: H_SV_MAN
param.documentation: Manual servo override for swash set-up. Must be 0 (Disabled) for flight!

param.name: H_CYC_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum cyclic pitch angle of the swash plate. There are no units to this parameter. This should be adjusted to get the desired cyclic blade pitch for the pitch and roll axes. Typically this should be 6-7 deg (measured blade pitch angle difference between stick centered and stick max deflection.

param.name: H_SV_TEST
param.documentation: Number of cycles to run servo test on boot-up

param.name: H_COLL_HOVER
param.documentation: Collective needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1 where 0 is H_COL_MIN and 1 is H_COL_MAX

param.name: H_HOVER_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover collective

param.name: H_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of heli options. Bit 0 changes how the pitch, roll, and yaw axis integrator term is managed for low speed and takeoff/landing. In AC 4.0 and earlier, scheme uses a leaky integrator for ground speeds less than 5 m/s and won't let the steady state integrator build above ILMI. The integrator is allowed to build to the ILMI value when it is landed. The other integrator management scheme bases integrator limiting on takeoff and landing. Whenever the aircraft is landed the integrator is set to zero. When the aicraft is airborne, the integrator is only limited by IMAX.

param.name: H_RSC_SETPOINT
param.documentation: Throttle (HeliRSC Servo) output in percent to the external motor governor when motor interlock enabled (throttle hold off).

param.name: H_RSC_MODE
param.documentation: Selects the type of rotor speed control used to determine throttle output to the HeliRSC servo channel when motor interlock is enabled (throttle hold off). RC Passthrough sends the input from the RC Motor Interlock channel as throttle output. External Gov SetPoint sends the RSC SetPoint parameter value as throttle output. Throttle Curve uses the 5 point throttle curve to determine throttle output based on the collective output. Governor is ArduCopter's built-in governor that uses the throttle curve for a feed forward throttle command to determine throttle output.

param.name: H_RSC_RAMP_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds for throttle output (HeliRSC servo) to ramp from ground idle (RSC_IDLE) to flight idle throttle setting when motor interlock is enabled (throttle hold off).

param.name: H_RSC_RUNUP_TIME
param.documentation: Actual time in seconds for the main rotor to reach full speed after motor interlock is enabled (throttle hold off). Must be at least one second longer than the Throttle Ramp Time that is set with RSC_RAMP_TIME.

param.name: H_RSC_CRITICAL
param.documentation: Percentage of normal rotor speed where flight is no longer possible. However currently the rotor runup/rundown is estimated using the RSC_RUNUP_TIME parameter. Estimated rotor speed increases/decreases between 0 (rotor stopped) to 1 (rotor at normal speed) in the RSC_RUNUP_TIME in seconds. This parameter should be set so that the estimated rotor speed goes below critical in approximately 3 seconds. So if you had a 10 second runup time then set RSC_CRITICAL to 70%.

param.name: H_RSC_IDLE
param.documentation: Throttle output (HeliRSC Servo) in percent while armed but motor interlock is disabled (throttle hold on). FOR COMBUSTION ENGINES. Sets the engine ground idle throttle percentage with clutch disengaged. This must be set to zero for electric helicopters under most situations. If the ESC has an autorotation window this can be set to keep the autorotation window open in the ESC. Consult the operating manual for your ESC to set it properly for this purpose

param.name: H_RSC_SLEWRATE
param.documentation: This controls the maximum rate at which the throttle output (HeliRSC servo) can change, as a percentage per second. A value of 100 means the throttle can change over its full range in one second. A value of zero gives unlimited slew rate.

param.name: H_RSC_THRCRV_0
param.documentation: Sets the throttle output (HeliRSC servo) in percent for the throttle curve at the minimum collective pitch position. The 0 percent collective is defined by H_COL_MIN. Example: if the setup has -2 degree to +10 degree collective pitch setup, this setting would correspond to -2 degree of pitch.

param.name: H_RSC_THRCRV_25
param.documentation: Sets the throttle output (HeliRSC servo) in percent for the throttle curve at 25% of full collective travel where he 0 percent collective is defined by H_COL_MIN and 100 percent collective is defined by H_COL_MAX. Example: if the setup has -2 degree to +10 degree collective pitch setup, the total range is 12 degrees. 25% of 12 degrees is 3 degrees, so this setting would correspond to +1 degree of pitch.

param.name: H_RSC_THRCRV_50
param.documentation: Sets the throttle output (HeliRSC servo) in percent for the throttle curve at 50% of full collective travel where he 0 percent collective is defined by H_COL_MIN and 100 percent collective is defined by H_COL_MAX. Example: if the setup has -2 degree to +10 degree collective pitch setup, the total range is 12 degrees. 50% of 12 degrees is 6 degrees, so this setting would correspond to +4 degree of pitch.

param.name: H_RSC_THRCRV_75
param.documentation: Sets the throttle output (HeliRSC servo) in percent for the throttle curve at 75% of full collective travel where he 0 percent collective is defined by H_COL_MIN and 100 percent collective is defined by H_COL_MAX. Example: if the setup has -2 degree to +10 degree collective pitch setup, the total range is 12 degrees. 75% of 12 degrees is 9 degrees, so this setting would correspond to +7 degree of pitch.

param.name: H_RSC_THRCRV_100
param.documentation: Sets the throttle output (HeliRSC servo) in percent for the throttle curve at the minimum collective pitch position. The 100 percent collective is defined by H_COL_MAX. Example: if the setup has -2 degree to +10 degree collective pitch setup, this setting would correspond to +10 degree of pitch.

param.name: H_RSC_GOV_SETPNT
param.documentation: Main rotor rpm setting that governor maintains when engaged. Set to the rotor rpm your helicopter runs in flight. When a speed sensor is installed the rotor governor maintains this speed. For governor operation this should be set 10 rpm higher than the actual desired headspeed to allow for governor droop

param.name: H_RSC_GOV_DISGAG
param.documentation: Percentage of throttle where the governor will disengage to allow return to flight idle power. Typically should be set to the same value as flight idle throttle (the very lowest throttle setting on the throttle curve). The governor disengage can be disabled by setting this value to zero and using the pull-down from the governor TCGAIN to reduce power to flight idle with the collective at it's lowest throttle setting on the throttle curve.

param.name: H_RSC_GOV_DROOP
param.documentation: Governor droop response under load, normal settings of 0-100%. Higher value is quicker response but may cause surging. Setting to zero disables the governor. Adjust this to be as aggressive as possible without getting surging or over-run on headspeed when the governor engages. Setting over 100% is allowable for some two-stage turbine engines to provide scheduling of the gas generator for proper torque response of the N2 spool

param.name: H_RSC_GOV_TCGAIN
param.documentation: Percentage of throttle curve gain in governor output. This provides a type of feedforward response to sudden loading or unloading of the engine. If headspeed drops excessively during sudden heavy load, increase the throttle curve gain. If the governor runs with excessive droop more than 15 rpm lower than the speed setting, increase this setting until the governor runs at 8-10 rpm droop from the speed setting. The throttle curve must be properly tuned to fly the helicopter without the governor for this setting to work properly.

param.name: H_RSC_GOV_RANGE
param.documentation: RPM range +/- governor rpm reference setting where governor is operational. If speed sensor fails or rpm falls outside of this range, the governor will disengage and return to throttle curve. Recommended range is 100

param.humanName: Autorotation Throttle Percentage for External Governor
param.name: H_RSC_AROT_PCT
param.documentation: The throttle percentage sent to external governors, signaling to enable fast spool-up, when bailing out of an autorotation. Set 0 to disable. If also using a tail rotor of type DDVP with external governor then this value must lie within the autorotation window of both governors.

param.name: IM_ACRO_COL_EXP
param.documentation: Used to soften collective pitch inputs near center point in Acro mode.

param.name: IM_STB_COL_1
param.documentation: Helicopter's minimum collective pitch setting at zero collective stick input in Stabilize mode. Set this as a percent of collective range given by H_COL_MAX minus H_COL_MIN.

param.name: IM_STB_COL_2
param.documentation: Helicopter's collective pitch setting at mid-low (40%) collective stick input in Stabilize mode. Set this as a percent of collective range given by H_COL_MAX minus H_COL_MIN.

param.name: IM_STB_COL_3
param.documentation: Helicopter's collective pitch setting at mid-high (60%) collective stick input in Stabilize mode. Set this as a percent of collective range given by H_COL_MAX minus H_COL_MIN.

param.name: IM_STB_COL_4
param.documentation: Helicopter's maximum collective pitch setting at full collective stick input in Stabilize mode. Set this as a percent of collective range given by H_COL_MAX minus H_COL_MIN.

param.name: INS_GYRO_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for gyroscopes. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.name: INS_ACCEL_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for accelerometers. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.humanName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE
param.documentation: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE2
param.documentation: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE3
param.documentation: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Stillness threshold for detecting if we are moving
param.name: INS_STILL_THRESH
param.documentation: Threshold to tolerate vibration to determine if vehicle is motionless. This depends on the frame type and if there is a constant vibration due to motors before launch or after landing. Total motionless is about 0.05. Suggested values: Planes/rover use 0.1, multirotors use 1, tradHeli uses 5

param.name: INS_GYR_CAL
param.documentation: Conrols when automatic gyro calibration is performed

param.name: INS_TRIM_OPTION
param.documentation: Specifies how the accel cal routine determines the trims

values.value: Assume ACC_BODYFIX is perfectly aligned to the vehicle

param.name: INS_ACC_BODYFIX
param.documentation: The body-fixed accelerometer to be used for trim calculation

param.name: INS_POS1_X
param.documentation: X position of the first IMU Accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_POS1_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_POS1_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the first IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_POS2_X
param.documentation: X position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_POS2_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the second IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_POS3_X
param.documentation: X position of the third IMU accelerometer in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_POS3_Y

Attention: The IMU should be located as close to the vehicle c.g. as practical so that the value of this parameter is minimised. Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

Failure to do so can result in noisy navigation velocity measurements due to vibration and IMU gyro noise. If the IMU cannot be moved and velocity noise is a problem, a location closer to the IMU can be used as the body frame origin.

param.name: INS_GYR_ID
param.documentation: Gyro sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: INS_GYR2_ID
param.documentation: Gyro2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: INS_GYR3_ID
param.documentation: Gyro3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: INS_ACC_ID
param.documentation: Accelerometer sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: INS_ACC2_ID
param.documentation: Accelerometer2 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: INS_ACC3_ID
param.documentation: Accelerometer3 sensor ID, taking into account its type, bus and instance

param.name: INS_FAST_SAMPLE
param.documentation: Mask of IMUs to enable fast sampling on, if available

param.name: INS_ENABLE_MASK
param.documentation: Bitmask of IMUs to enable. It can be used to prevent startup of specific detected IMUs

param.humanName: Gyro rate for IMUs with Fast Sampling enabled
param.name: INS_GYRO_RATE
param.documentation: Gyro rate for IMUs with fast sampling enabled. The gyro rate is the sample rate at which the IMU filters operate and needs to be at least double the maximum filter frequency. If the sensor does not support the selected rate the next highest supported rate will be used. For IMUs which do not support fast sampling this setting is ignored and the default gyro rate of 1Khz is used.

param.name: INS_ACC1_CALTEMP
param.documentation: Temperature that the 1st accelerometer was calibrated at

param.name: INS_GYR1_CALTEMP
param.documentation: Temperature that the 1st gyroscope was calibrated at

param.name: INS_ACC2_CALTEMP
param.documentation: Temperature that the 2nd accelerometer was calibrated at

param.name: INS_GYR2_CALTEMP
param.documentation: Temperature that the 2nd gyroscope was calibrated at

param.name: INS_ACC3_CALTEMP
param.documentation: Temperature that the 3rd accelerometer was calibrated at

param.name: INS_GYR3_CALTEMP
param.documentation: Temperature that the 3rd gyroscope was calibrated at

param.name: INS_TCAL_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This enables optional temperature calibration features. Setting PersistParams will save the accelerometer and temperature calibration parameters in the bootloader sector on the next update of the bootloader.

param.name: INS_HNTCH_ENABLE
param.documentation: Harmonic Notch Filter enable

param.name: INS_HNTCH_FREQ
param.documentation: Harmonic Notch Filter base center frequency in Hz. This should be set at most half the backend gyro rate (which is typically 1Khz). For helicopters using RPM sensor to dynamically set the notch frequency, use this parameter to provide a lower limit to the dynamic notch filter. Recommend setting it to half the operating rotor speed in Hz.

param.name: INS_HNTCH_BW
param.documentation: Harmonic Notch Filter bandwidth in Hz. This is typically set to half the base frequency. The ratio of base frequency to bandwidth determines the notch quality factor and is fixed across harmonics.

param.name: INS_HNTCH_ATT
param.documentation: Harmonic Notch Filter attenuation in dB. Values greater than 40dB will typically produce a hard notch rather than a modest attenuation of motor noise.

param.name: INS_HNTCH_HMNCS
param.documentation: Bitmask of harmonic frequencies to apply Harmonic Notch Filter to. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A maximum of 3 harmonics can be used at any one time.
param.field: 0:1st harmonic,1:2nd harmonic,2:3rd harmonic,3:4th hamronic,4:5th harmonic,5:6th harmonic,6:7th harmonic,7:8th harmonic

param.name: INS_HNTCH_REF
param.documentation: A reference value of zero disables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter and a positive value enables dynamic updates on the Harmonic Notch Filter. For throttle-based scaling, this parameter is the reference value associated with the specified frequency to facilitate frequency scaling of the Harmonic Notch Filter. For RPM and ESC telemetry based tracking, this parameter is set to 1 to enable the Harmonic Notch Filter using the RPM sensor or ESC telemetry set to measure rotor speed. The sensor data is converted to Hz automatically for use in the Harmonic Notch Filter. This reference value may also be used to scale the sensor data, if required. For example, rpm sensor data is required to measure heli motor RPM. Therefore the reference value can be used to scale the RPM sensor to the rotor RPM.

param.humanName: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode
param.name: INS_HNTCH_MODE
param.documentation: Harmonic Notch Filter dynamic frequency tracking mode. Dynamic updates can be throttle, RPM sensor, ESC telemetry or dynamic FFT based. Throttle-based updates should only be used with multicopters.

param.name: INS_HNTCH_OPTS
param.documentation: Harmonic Notch Filter options. Double-notches can provide deeper attenuation across a wider bandwidth than single notches and are suitable for larger aircraft. Dynamic harmonics attaches a harmonic notch to each detected noise frequency instead of simply being multiples of the base frequency, in the case of FFT it will attach notches to each of three detected noise peaks, in the case of ESC it will attach notches to each of four motor RPM values. Loop rate update changes the notch center frequency at the scheduler loop rate rather than at the default of 200Hz.

param.name: INS_LOG_BAT_CNT
param.documentation: Number of samples to take when logging streams of IMU sensor readings. Will be rounded down to a multiple of 32. This option takes effect on the next reboot.

param.name: INS_LOG_BAT_MASK
param.documentation: Bitmap of which IMUs to log batch data for. This option takes effect on the next reboot.

param.name: INS_LOG_BAT_OPT
param.documentation: Options for the BatchSampler. Post-filter and sensor-rate logging cannot be used at the same time.
param.field: 0:Sensor-Rate Logging (sample at full sensor rate seen by AP), 1: Sample post-filtering

param.name: INS_LOG_BAT_LGIN
param.documentation: Interval between pushing samples to the AP_Logger log

param.name: INS_LOG_BAT_LGCT
param.documentation: Number of samples to push to count every INS_LOG_BAT_LGIN

param.name: INS_NOTCH_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable notch filter

param.name: INS_NOTCH_ATT
param.documentation: Notch attenuation in dB

param.name: INS_NOTCH_FREQ
param.documentation: Notch center frequency in Hz

param.name: INS_NOTCH_BW
param.documentation: Notch bandwidth in Hz

param.name: LGR_STARTUP
param.documentation: Landing Gear Startup behaviour control

param.name: LGR_DEPLOY_PIN
param.documentation: Pin number to use for detection of gear deployment. If set to -1 feedback is disabled.

param.name: LGR_DEPLOY_POL
param.documentation: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the pin should be high when gear are deployed. If set to 0 then then deployed gear level is low.

param.name: LGR_WOW_PIN
param.documentation: Pin number to use for feedback of weight on wheels condition. If set to -1 feedback is disabled.

param.humanName: Weight on wheels feedback pin polarity
param.name: LGR_WOW_POL
param.documentation: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the pin should be high when there is weight on wheels. If set to 0 then then weight on wheels level is low.

param.name: LGR_DEPLOY_ALT
param.documentation: Altitude where the landing gear will be deployed. This should be lower than the RETRACT_ALT. If zero then altitude is not used for deploying landing gear. Only applies when vehicle is armed.

param.name: LGR_RETRACT_ALT
param.documentation: Altitude where the landing gear will be retracted. This should be higher than the DEPLOY_ALT. If zero then altitude is not used for retracting landing gear. Only applies when vehicle is armed.

param.name: LGR_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Options to retract or deploy landing gear in Auto or Guided mode

param.name: LOG_BACKEND_TYPE
param.documentation: Bitmap of what Logger backend types to enable. Block-based logging is available on SITL and boards with dataflash chips. Multiple backends can be selected.

param.humanName: Maximum AP_Logger File and Block Backend buffer size (in kilobytes)
param.name: LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE
param.documentation: The File and Block backends use a buffer to store data before writing to the block device. Raising this value may reduce "gaps" in your SD card logging. This buffer size may be reduced depending on available memory. PixHawk requires at least 4 kilobytes. Maximum value available here is 64 kilobytes.

param.name: LOG_DISARMED
param.documentation: If LOG_DISARMED is set to 1 then logging will be enabled while disarmed. This can make for very large logfiles but can help a lot when tracking down startup issues

param.humanName: Enable logging of information needed for Replay
param.name: LOG_REPLAY
param.documentation: If LOG_REPLAY is set to 1 then the EKF2 state estimator will log detailed information needed for diagnosing problems with the Kalman filter. It is suggested that you also raise LOG_FILE_BUFSIZE to give more buffer space for logging and use a high quality microSD card to ensure no sensor data is lost

param.humanName: Stop logging to current file on disarm
param.name: LOG_FILE_DSRMROT
param.documentation: When set, the current log file is closed when the vehicle is disarmed. If LOG_DISARMED is set then a fresh log will be opened. Applies to the File and Block logging backends.

param.humanName: Maximum AP_Logger MAVLink Backend buffer size
param.name: LOG_MAV_BUFSIZE
param.documentation: Maximum amount of memory to allocate to AP_Logger-over-mavlink

param.humanName: Timeout before giving up on file writes
param.name: LOG_FILE_TIMEOUT
param.documentation: This controls the amount of time before failing writes to a log file cause the file to be closed and logging stopped.

param.humanName: Old logs on the SD card will be deleted to maintain this amount of free space
param.name: LOG_FILE_MB_FREE
param.documentation: Set this such that the free space is larger than your largest typical flight log

param.name: LOIT_ANG_MAX
param.documentation: Loiter maximum lean angle. Set to zero for 2/3 of PSC_ANGLE_MAX or ANGLE_MAX

param.name: LOIT_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

param.name: LOIT_ACC_MAX
param.documentation: Loiter maximum correction acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values cause the copter to correct position errors more aggressively.

param.name: LOIT_BRK_ACCEL
param.documentation: Loiter braking acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values stop the copter more quickly when the stick is centered.

param.name: LOIT_BRK_JERK
param.documentation: Loiter braking jerk in cm/s/s/s. Higher values will remove braking faster if the pilot moves the sticks during a braking maneuver.

param.name: LOIT_BRK_DELAY
param.documentation: Loiter brake start delay (in seconds)

param.name: MIS_TOTAL
param.documentation: The number of mission mission items that has been loaded by the ground station. Do not change this manually.

param.humanName: Mission Restart when entering Auto mode
param.name: MIS_RESTART
param.documentation: Controls mission starting point when entering Auto mode (either restart from beginning of mission or resume from last command run)

param.name: MIS_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of what options to use in missions.

param.name: MNT_TYPE
param.documentation: Mount Type (None, Servo or MAVLink)

param.name: MNT_DEFLT_MODE
param.documentation: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_Z
param.documentation: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_Z
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

param.name: MNT_STAB_ROLL
param.documentation: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_STAB_TILT
param.documentation: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_JSTICK_SPD
param.documentation: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

param.name: MNT_LEAD_RLL
param.documentation: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate, compensating for servo delay. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

param.name: MNT_LEAD_PTCH
param.documentation: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

param.name: MNT2_DEFLT_MODE
param.documentation: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

param.humanName: Mount2 roll angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT2_RETRACT_X
param.documentation: Mount2 roll angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT2_RETRACT_Y
param.documentation: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount2 yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT2_RETRACT_Z
param.documentation: Mount2 yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount2 roll angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT2_NEUTRAL_X
param.documentation: Mount2 roll angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT2_NEUTRAL_Y
param.documentation: Mount2 tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount2 pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT2_NEUTRAL_Z
param.documentation: Mount2 pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

param.name: MNT2_STAB_ROLL
param.documentation: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT2_STAB_TILT
param.documentation: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT2_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Mount2's minimum physical roll angular position

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Mount2's maximum physical roll angular position

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Mount2's minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Mount2's maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position

param.name: MNT2_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Mount2's minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: MOunt2's maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position

param.name: MNT2_LEAD_RLL
param.documentation: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate, compensating for servo delay. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

param.name: MNT2_LEAD_PTCH
param.documentation: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

param.name: MNT2_TYPE
param.documentation: Mount Type (None, Servo or MAVLink)

param.name: MOT_YAW_HEADROOM
param.documentation: Yaw control is given at least this pwm in microseconds range

param.name: MOT_THST_EXPO
param.documentation: Motor thrust curve exponent (0.0 for linear to 1.0 for second order curve)

param.name: MOT_SPIN_MAX
param.documentation: Point at which the thrust saturates expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range

param.name: MOT_BAT_VOLT_MAX
param.documentation: Battery voltage compensation maximum voltage (voltage above this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 4.2 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

param.name: MOT_BAT_VOLT_MIN
param.documentation: Battery voltage compensation minimum voltage (voltage below this will have no additional scaling effect on thrust). Recommend 3.3 * cell count, 0 = Disabled

param.name: MOT_BAT_CURR_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum current over which maximum throttle is limited (0 = Disabled)

param.name: MOT_PWM_TYPE
param.documentation: This selects the output PWM type, allowing for normal PWM continuous output, OneShot, brushed or DShot motor output

param.name: MOT_PWM_MIN
param.documentation: This sets the min PWM output value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MIN

param.name: MOT_PWM_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the max PWM value in microseconds that will ever be output to the motors, 0 = use input RC3_MAX

param.name: MOT_SPIN_MIN
param.documentation: Point at which the thrust starts expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be higher than MOT_SPIN_ARM.

param.name: MOT_SPIN_ARM
param.documentation: Point at which the motors start to spin expressed as a number from 0 to 1 in the entire output range. Should be lower than MOT_SPIN_MIN.

param.name: MOT_BAT_CURR_TC
param.documentation: Time constant used to limit the maximum current

param.name: MOT_THST_HOVER
param.documentation: Motor thrust needed to hover expressed as a number from 0 to 1

param.name: MOT_HOVER_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable/Disable automatic learning of hover throttle

param.humanName: Motor PWM output disabled when disarmed
param.name: MOT_SAFE_DISARM
param.documentation: Disables motor PWM output when disarmed

param.name: MOT_YAW_SV_ANGLE
param.documentation: Yaw servo's maximum lean angle

param.name: MOT_SPOOL_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds to spool up the motors from zero to min throttle.

param.name: MOT_BOOST_SCALE
param.documentation: Booster motor output scaling factor vs main throttle. The output to the BoostThrottle servo will be the main throttle times this scaling factor. A higher scaling factor will put more of the load on the booster motor. A value of 1 will set the BoostThrottle equal to the main throttle.

param.name: MOT_BAT_IDX
param.documentation: Which battery monitor should be used for doing compensation

param.humanName: Output slew time for increasing throttle
param.name: MOT_SLEW_UP_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds to slew output from zero to full. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.

param.humanName: Output slew time for decreasing throttle
param.name: MOT_SLEW_DN_TIME
param.documentation: Time in seconds to slew output from full to zero. This is used to limit the rate at which output can change. Range is constrained between 0 and 0.5.

param.humanName: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.
param.name: MOT_SAFE_TIME
param.documentation: Time taken to disable and enable the motor PWM output when disarmed and armed.

param.name: MSP_OSD_NCELLS
param.documentation: Used for average cell voltage calculation

param.name: MSP_OPTIONS
param.documentation: A bitmask to set some MSP specific options

param.name: NTF_LED_BRIGHT
param.documentation: Select the RGB LED brightness level. When USB is connected brightness will never be higher than low regardless of the setting.

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_TYPES
param.documentation: Controls what types of Buzzer will be enabled

param.humanName: Specifies colour source for the RGBLed
param.name: NTF_LED_OVERRIDE
param.documentation: Specifies the source for the colours and brightness for the LED. OutbackChallenge conforms to the MedicalExpress (https://uavchallenge.org/medical-express/) rules, essentially "Green" is disarmed (safe-to-approach), "Red" is armed (not safe-to-approach). Traffic light is a simplified color set, red when armed, yellow when the safety switch is not surpressing outputs (but disarmed), and green when outputs are surpressed and disarmed, the LED will blink faster if disarmed and failing arming checks.

param.name: NTF_DISPLAY_TYPE
param.documentation: This sets up the type of on-board I2C display. Disabled by default.

param.name: NTF_OREO_THEME
param.documentation: Enable/Disable Solo Oreo LED driver, 0 to disable, 1 for Aircraft theme, 2 for Rover theme

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_PIN
param.documentation: Enables to connect active buzzer to arbitrary pin. Requires 3-pin buzzer or additional MOSFET!

param.name: NTF_LED_TYPES
param.documentation: Controls what types of LEDs will be enabled
param.field: 0:Built-in LED, 1:Internal ToshibaLED, 2:External ToshibaLED, 3:External PCA9685, 4:Oreo LED, 5:UAVCAN, 6:NCP5623 External, 7:NCP5623 Internal, 8:NeoPixel, 9:ProfiLED, 10:Scripting, 11:DShot

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_ON_LVL
param.documentation: Specifies pin level that indicates buzzer should play

param.name: NTF_BUZZ_VOLUME
param.documentation: Control the volume of the buzzer

param.name: NTF_LED_LEN
param.documentation: The number of Serial LED's to use for notifications (NeoPixel's and ProfiLED)

param.humanName: Object Avoidance Path Planning algorithm to use
param.name: OA_TYPE
param.documentation: Enabled/disable path planning around obstacles

param.name: OA_MARGIN_MAX
param.documentation: Object Avoidance will ignore objects more than this many meters from vehicle

param.humanName: Object Avoidance look ahead distance maximum
param.name: OA_BR_LOOKAHEAD
param.documentation: Object Avoidance will look this many meters ahead of vehicle

param.humanName: Obstacle Avoidance margin ratio for BendyRuler to change bearing significantly
param.name: OA_BR_CONT_RATIO
param.documentation: BendyRuler will avoid changing bearing unless ratio of previous margin from obstacle (or fence) to present calculated margin is atleast this much.

param.humanName: BendyRuler's bearing change resistance threshold angle
param.name: OA_BR_CONT_ANGLE
param.documentation: BendyRuler will resist changing current bearing if the change in bearing is over this angle

param.name: OA_BR_TYPE
param.documentation: BendyRuler will search for clear path along the direction defined by this parameter

param.name: OA_DB_SIZE
param.documentation: OADatabase maximum number of points. Set to 0 to disable the OA Database. Larger means more points but is more cpu intensive to process

param.name: OA_DB_EXPIRE
param.documentation: OADatabase item timeout. The time an item will linger without any updates before it expires. Zero means never expires which is useful for a sent-once static environment but terrible for dynamic ones.

param.humanName: OADatabase queue maximum number of points
param.name: OA_DB_QUEUE_SIZE
param.documentation: OADatabase queue maximum number of points. This in an input buffer size. Larger means it can handle larger bursts of incoming data points to filter into the database. No impact on cpu, only RAM. Recommend larger for faster datalinks or for sensors that generate a lot of data.

param.name: OA_DB_OUTPUT
param.documentation: OADatabase output level to configure which database objects are sent to the ground station. All data is always available internally for avoidance algorithms.

values.value: Send HIGH and NORMAL importance items

param.name: OA_DB_BEAM_WIDTH
param.documentation: Beam width of incoming lidar data

param.name: OA_DB_RADIUS_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum radius of objects held in database

param.name: OA_DB_DIST_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum distance of objects held in database. Set to zero to disable the limits

param.humanName: OADatabase minimum altitude above home before storing obstacles
param.name: OA_DB_ALT_MIN
param.documentation: OADatabase will reject obstacle's if vehicle's altitude above home is below this parameter, in a 3 meter radius around home. Set 0 to disable this feature.

param.name: OSD_TYPE
param.documentation: OSD type. TXONLY makes the OSD parameter selection available to other modules even if there is no native OSD support on the board, for instance CRSF.

param.name: OSD_CHAN
param.documentation: This sets the channel used to switch different OSD screens.

param.name: OSD_SW_METHOD
param.documentation: This sets the method used to switch different OSD screens.

values.value: switch to next screen if channel value was changed
select screen based on pwm ranges specified for each screen
switch to next screen after low to high transition and every 1s while channel value is high

param.name: OSD_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This sets options that change the display

param.name: OSD_FONT
param.documentation: This sets which OSD font to use. It is an integer from 0 to the number of fonts available

param.name: OSD_V_OFFSET
param.documentation: Sets vertical offset of the osd inside image

param.name: OSD_H_OFFSET
param.documentation: Sets horizontal offset of the osd inside image

param.name: OSD_W_RSSI
param.documentation: Set level at which RSSI item will flash

param.name: OSD_W_NSAT
param.documentation: Set level at which NSAT item will flash

param.name: OSD_W_BATVOLT
param.documentation: Set level at which BAT_VOLT item will flash

param.name: OSD_UNITS
param.documentation: Sets the units to use in displaying items

param.name: OSD_MSG_TIME
param.documentation: Sets message duration seconds

param.name: OSD_ARM_SCR
param.documentation: Screen to be shown on Arm event. Zero to disable the feature.

param.name: OSD_DSARM_SCR
param.documentation: Screen to be shown on disarm event. Zero to disable the feature.

param.name: OSD_FS_SCR
param.documentation: Screen to be shown on failsafe event. Zero to disable the feature.

param.name: OSD_BTN_DELAY
param.documentation: Debounce time in ms for stick commanded parameter navigation.

param.name: OSD_W_TERR
param.documentation: Set level below which TER_HGT item will flash. -1 disables.

param.name: OSD_W_AVGCELLV
param.documentation: Set level at which AVGCELLV item will flash

param.name: OSD_CELL_COUNT
param.documentation: Used for average cell voltage display. -1 disables, 0 uses cell count autodetection for well charged LIPO/LIION batteries at connection, other values manually select cell count used.

param.name: OSD_W_RESTVOLT
param.documentation: Set level at which RESTVOLT item will flash

param.name: OSD1_ENABLE
param.documentation: Enable this screen

param.name: OSD1_CHAN_MIN
param.documentation: This sets the PWM lower limit for this screen

param.name: OSD1_CHAN_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the PWM upper limit for this screen

param.name: PLND_ENABLED
param.documentation: Precision Land enabled/disabled

param.name: PLND_TYPE
param.documentation: Precision Land Type

param.name: PLND_YAW_ALIGN
param.documentation: Yaw angle from body x-axis to sensor x-axis.

param.name: PLND_LAND_OFS_X
param.documentation: Desired landing position of the camera forward of the target in vehicle body frame

param.name: PLND_LAND_OFS_Y
param.documentation: desired landing position of the camera right of the target in vehicle body frame

param.name: PLND_EST_TYPE
param.documentation: Specifies the estimation method to be used

param.name: PLND_ACC_P_NSE
param.documentation: Kalman Filter Accelerometer Noise, higher values weight the input from the camera more, accels less

param.name: PLND_CAM_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

param.name: PLND_CAM_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

param.name: PLND_CAM_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

param.name: PLND_BUS
param.documentation: Precland sensor bus for I2C sensors.

param.name: PLND_LAG
param.documentation: Precision Landing sensor lag, to cope with variable landing_target latency

param.name: PRX_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of proximity sensor is connected

param.name: PRX_ORIENT
param.documentation: Proximity sensor orientation

param.name: PRX_YAW_CORR
param.documentation: Proximity sensor yaw correction

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG1
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 1

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID1
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 1

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG2
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 2

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID2
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 2

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG3
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 3

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID3
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 3

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG4
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 4

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID4
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 4

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG5
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 5

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID5
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 5

param.name: PRX_IGN_ANG6
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore angle 6

param.name: PRX_IGN_WID6
param.documentation: Proximity sensor ignore width 6

param.name: PRX_IGN_GND
param.documentation: Ignore proximity data that is within 1 meter of the ground below the vehicle. This requires a downward facing rangefinder

param.name: PRX_LOG_RAW
param.documentation: Set this parameter to one if logging unfiltered(raw) distances from sensor should be enabled

param.name: PRX_FILT
param.documentation: Cutoff frequency for low pass filter applied to each face in the proximity boundary

param.name: PSC_ACC_XY_FILT
param.documentation: Lower values will slow the response of the navigation controller and reduce twitchiness

param.name: PSC_POSZ_P
param.documentation: Position (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

param.name: PSC_VELZ_P
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

param.name: PSC_VELZ_I
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: PSC_VELZ_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: PSC_VELZ_D
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: PSC_VELZ_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) controller Feed Forward gain. Produces an output that is proportional to the magnitude of the target

param.name: PSC_VELZ_FLTE
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) error filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.humanName: Velocity (vertical) input filter for D term
param.name: PSC_VELZ_FLTD
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) input filter for D term. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D terms

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_P
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_I
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_IMAX
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_D
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_FF
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller feed forward

param.humanName: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz
param.name: PSC_ACCZ_FLTT
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller target frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz
param.name: PSC_ACCZ_FLTE
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller error frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz
param.name: PSC_ACCZ_FLTD
param.documentation: Acceleration (vertical) controller derivative frequency in Hz

param.name: PSC_ACCZ_SMAX
param.documentation: Sets an upper limit on the slew rate produced by the combined P and D gains. If the amplitude of the control action produced by the rate feedback exceeds this value, then the D+P gain is reduced to respect the limit. This limits the amplitude of high frequency oscillations caused by an excessive gain. The limit should be set to no more than 25% of the actuators maximum slew rate to allow for load effects. Note: The gain will not be reduced to less than 10% of the nominal value. A value of zero will disable this feature.

param.name: PSC_POSXY_P
param.documentation: Position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

param.name: PSC_VELXY_P
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: PSC_VELXY_I
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference between desired and actual velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: PSC_VELXY_D
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) D gain. Corrects short-term changes in velocity

param.name: PSC_VELXY_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: PSC_VELXY_FILT
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for P and I terms

param.name: PSC_VELXY_D_FILT
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) input filter. This filter (in Hz) is applied to the input for D term

param.name: PSC_VELXY_FF
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) feed forward gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: PSC_ANGLE_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum lean angle autopilot can request. Set to zero to use ANGLE_MAX parameter value

param.humanName: Time constant for the horizontal kinimatic input shaping
param.name: PSC_TC_XY
param.documentation: Time constant of the horizontal kinimatic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target

param.humanName: Time constant for the vertical kinimatic input shaping
param.name: PSC_TC_Z
param.documentation: Time constant of the vertical kinimatic path generation used to determine how quickly the aircraft varies the acceleration target

param.name: RALLY_TOTAL
param.documentation: Number of rally points currently loaded

param.name: RALLY_LIMIT_KM
param.documentation: Maximum distance to rally point. If the closest rally point is more than this number of kilometers from the current position and the home location is closer than any of the rally points from the current position then do RTL to home rather than to the closest rally point. This prevents a leftover rally point from a different airfield being used accidentally. If this is set to 0 then the closest rally point is always used.

param.name: RALLY_INCL_HOME
param.documentation: Controls if Home is included as a Rally point (i.e. as a safe landing place) for RTL

param.name: RC_OVERRIDE_TIME
param.documentation: Timeout after which RC overrides will no longer be used, and RC input will resume, 0 will disable RC overrides, -1 will never timeout, and continue using overrides until they are disabled

param.name: RC_OPTIONS
param.documentation: RC input options
param.field: 0:Ignore RC Receiver, 1:Ignore MAVLink Overrides, 2:Ignore Receiver Failsafe bit but allow other RC failsafes if setup, 3:FPort Pad, 4:Log RC input bytes, 5:Arming check throttle for 0 input, 6:Skip the arming check for neutral Roll/Pitch/Yay sticks, 7:Allow Switch reverse, 8:Use passthrough for CRSF telemetry

param.name: RC_PROTOCOLS
param.documentation: Bitmask of enabled RC protocols. Allows narrowing the protocol detection to only specific types of RC receivers which can avoid issues with incorrect detection. Set to 1 to enable all protocols.

param.name: RC10_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC10_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC10_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC10_REVERSED
param.documentation: Reverse channel input. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this input channel.

param.name: RC10_DZ
param.documentation: PWM dead zone in microseconds around trim or bottom

param.name: RC10_OPTION
param.documentation: Function assigned to this RC channel

param.name: RCMAP_ROLL
param.documentation: Roll channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Roll is normally on channel 1, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_PITCH
param.documentation: Pitch channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Pitch is normally on channel 2, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_THROTTLE
param.documentation: Throttle channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Throttle is normally on channel 3, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Warning APM 2.X: Changing the throttle channel could produce unexpected fail-safe results if connection between receiver and on-board PPM Encoder is lost. Disabling on-board PPM Encoder is recommended. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RCMAP_YAW
param.documentation: Yaw channel number. This is useful when you have a RC transmitter that can't change the channel order easily. Yaw (also known as rudder) is normally on channel 4, but you can move it to any channel with this parameter. Reboot is required for changes to take effect.

param.name: RELAY_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin number for first relay control. This is the pin used for camera control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN2
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 2nd relay control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN3
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 3rd relay control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN4
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 4th relay control.

param.name: RELAY_DEFAULT
param.documentation: The state of the relay on boot.

param.name: RELAY_PIN5
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 5th relay control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN6
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 6th relay control.

param.name: RNGFND1_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

param.name: RNGFND1_PIN
param.documentation: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input

param.name: RNGFND1_SCALING
param.documentation: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

param.name: RNGFND1_OFFSET
param.documentation: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

param.name: RNGFND1_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

param.name: RNGFND1_MIN_CM
param.documentation: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND1_MAX_CM
param.documentation: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND1_STOP_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.

param.name: RNGFND1_RMETRIC
param.documentation: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

param.name: RNGFND1_PWRRNG
param.documentation: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled

param.humanName: Distance (in cm) from the range finder to the ground
param.name: RNGFND1_GNDCLEAR
param.documentation: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

param.name: RNGFND1_ADDR
param.documentation: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and UAVCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

param.name: RNGFND1_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND1_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND1_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND1_ORIENT
param.documentation: Orientation of rangefinder

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_MAVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_MEDF
param.documentation: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_FRQ
param.documentation: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_AVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_THR
param.documentation: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

param.name: RNGFND1_WSP_BAUD
param.documentation: Desired baud rate

param.name: RNGFND2_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

param.name: RNGFND2_PIN
param.documentation: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input

param.documentation: This parameter sets the expected range measurement(in cm) that the range finder should return when the vehicle is on the ground.

param.name: RNGFND4_ADDR
param.documentation: This sets the bus address of the sensor, where applicable. Used for the I2C and UAVCAN sensors to allow for multiple sensors on different addresses.

param.name: RNGFND4_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND4_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND4_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the rangefinder in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin. Use the zero range datum point if supplied.

param.name: RNGFND4_ORIENT
param.documentation: Orientation of rangefinder

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_MAVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of historic range results to use for calculating the current range result. When MAVG is greater than 1, the current range result will be the current measured value averaged with the N-1 previous results

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_MEDF
param.documentation: Sets the window size for the real-time median filter. When MEDF is greater than 0 the median filter is active

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_FRQ
param.documentation: Sets the repetition frequency of the ranging operation in Hertz. Upon entering the desired frequency the system will calculate the nearest frequency that it can handle according to the resolution of internal timers.

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_AVG
param.documentation: Sets the number of pulses to be used in multi-pulse averaging mode. In this mode, a sequence of rapid fire ranges are taken and then averaged to improve the accuracy of the measurement

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_THR
param.documentation: Sets the system sensitivity. Larger values of THR represent higher sensitivity. The system may limit the maximum value of THR to prevent excessive false alarm rates based on settings made at the factory. Set to -1 for automatic threshold adjustments

param.name: RNGFND4_WSP_BAUD
param.documentation: Desired baud rate

param.name: RNGFND5_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of rangefinder device that is connected

param.name: RNGFND5_PIN
param.documentation: Analog or PWM input pin that rangefinder is connected to. Airspeed ports can be used for Analog input, AUXOUT can be used for PWM input

param.name: RNGFND5_SCALING
param.documentation: Scaling factor between rangefinder reading and distance. For the linear and inverted functions this is in meters per volt. For the hyperbolic function the units are meterVolts.

param.name: RNGFND5_OFFSET
param.documentation: Offset in volts for zero distance for analog rangefinders. Offset added to distance in centimeters for PWM lidars

param.name: RNGFND5_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Control over what function is used to calculate distance. For a linear function, the distance is (voltage-offset)*scaling. For a inverted function the distance is (offset-voltage)*scaling. For a hyperbolic function the distance is scaling/(voltage-offset). The functions return the distance in meters.

param.name: RNGFND5_MIN_CM
param.documentation: Minimum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND5_MAX_CM
param.documentation: Maximum distance in centimeters that rangefinder can reliably read

param.name: RNGFND5_STOP_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin that enables/disables rangefinder measurement for the pwm rangefinder. A value of -1 means no pin. If this is set, then the pin is set to 1 to enable the rangefinder and set to 0 to disable it. This is used to enable powersaving when out of range.

param.name: RNGFND5_RMETRIC
param.documentation: This parameter sets whether an analog rangefinder is ratiometric. Most analog rangefinders are ratiometric, meaning that their output voltage is influenced by the supply voltage. Some analog rangefinders (such as the SF/02) have their own internal voltage regulators so they are not ratiometric.

param.name: RNGFND5_PWRRNG
param.documentation: This parameter sets the estimated terrain distance in meters above which the sensor will be put into a power saving mode (if available). A value of zero means power saving is not enabled
