param.name: RPM_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum RPM to report

param.name: RPM_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum RPM to report

param.name: RPM_MIN_QUAL
param.documentation: Minimum data quality to be used

param.name: RPM_PIN
param.documentation: Which pin to use

param.name: RPM2_TYPE
param.documentation: What type of RPM sensor is connected

param.name: RPM2_SCALING
param.documentation: Scaling factor between sensor reading and RPM.

param.name: RPM2_PIN
param.documentation: Which pin to use

param.name: RSSI_TYPE
param.documentation: Radio Receiver RSSI type. If your radio receiver supports RSSI of some kind, set it here, then set its associated RSSI_XXXXX parameters, if any.

param.name: RSSI_ANA_PIN
param.documentation: Pin used to read the RSSI voltage or PWM value

param.name: RSSI_PIN_LOW
param.documentation: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_PIN_HIGH

param.name: RSSI_PIN_HIGH
param.documentation: RSSI pin's voltage received on the RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers put out inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_PIN_LOW

param.name: RSSI_CHANNEL
param.documentation: The channel number where RSSI will be output by the radio receiver (5 and above).

param.name: RSSI_CHAN_LOW
param.documentation: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the weakest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be lower than RSSI_CHAN_HIGH

param.name: RSSI_CHAN_HIGH
param.documentation: PWM value that the radio receiver will put on the RSSI_CHANNEL or RSSI_ANA_PIN when the signal strength is the strongest. Some radio receivers output inverted values so this value may be higher than RSSI_CHAN_LOW

param.name: SCHED_DEBUG
param.documentation: Set to non-zero to enable scheduler debug messages. When set to show "Slips" the scheduler will display a message whenever a scheduled task is delayed due to too much CPU load. When set to ShowOverruns the scheduled will display a message whenever a task takes longer than the limit promised in the task table.

param.name: SCHED_LOOP_RATE
param.documentation: This controls the rate of the main control loop in Hz. This should only be changed by developers. This only takes effect on restart. Values over 400 are considered highly experimental.

param.name: SCHED_OPTIONS
param.documentation: This controls optional aspects of the scheduler.

param.name: SCR_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls if scripting is enabled

param.name: SCR_VM_I_COUNT
param.documentation: The number virtual machine instructions that can be run before considering a script to have taken an excessive amount of time

param.name: SCR_HEAP_SIZE
param.documentation: Amount of memory available for scripting

param.name: SCR_DEBUG_LVL
param.documentation: The higher the number the more verbose builtin scripting debug will be.

param.name: SCR_USER1
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_USER2
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_USER3
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_USER4
param.documentation: General purpose user variable input for scripts

param.name: SCR_DIR_DISABLE
param.documentation: This will stop scripts being loaded from the given locations

param.name: SERIAL0_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the USB console. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL0_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the console.

param.name: SERIAL1_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL1_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL2_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the Telem2 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL2_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL3_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial 3 (GPS) should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL3_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for the Serial 3 (GPS). Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL4_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial4 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL4_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial4. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL5_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial5 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL5_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial5. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL6_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial6 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL6_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial6. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL1_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire. The Swap option allows the RX and TX pins to be swapped on STM32F7 based boards.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL2_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL3_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL4_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL5_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL6_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL_PASS1
param.documentation: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

param.name: SERIAL_PASS2
param.documentation: This sets one side of pass-through between two serial ports. Once both sides are set then all data received on either port will be passed to the other port

param.name: SERIAL_PASSTIMO
param.documentation: This sets a timeout for serial pass-through in seconds. When the pass-through is enabled by setting the SERIAL_PASS1 and SERIAL_PASS2 parameters then it remains in effect until no data comes from the first port for SERIAL_PASSTIMO seconds. This allows the port to revent to its normal usage (such as MAVLink connection to a GCS) when it is no longer needed. A value of 0 means no timeout.

param.name: SERIAL7_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial7 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL7_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial7. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL7_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERIAL8_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial8 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL8_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial7. Most stm32-based boards can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL8_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Control over UART options. The InvertRX option controls invert of the receive pin. The InvertTX option controls invert of the transmit pin. The HalfDuplex option controls half-duplex (onewire) mode, where both transmit and receive is done on the transmit wire.
param.field: 0:InvertRX, 1:InvertTX, 2:HalfDuplex, 3:Swap, 4: RX_PullDown, 5: RX_PullUp, 6: TX_PullDown, 7: TX_PullUp, 8: RX_NoDMA, 9: TX_NoDMA, 10: Don't forward mavlink to/from

param.name: SERVO_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the default output rate in Hz for all outputs.

param.name: SERVO_DSHOT_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the DShot output rate for all outputs as a multiple of the loop rate. 0 sets the output rate to be fixed at 1Khz for low loop rates. This value should never be set below 500Hz.

param.name: SERVO_DSHOT_ESC
param.documentation: This sets the DShot ESC type for all outputs. The ESC type affects the range of DShot commands available. None means that no dshot commands will be executed.

param.name: SERVO10_MIN
param.documentation: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_MAX
param.documentation: maximum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_TRIM
param.documentation: Trim PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO10_REVERSED
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 0 for normal operation. Set to 1 to reverse this output channel.

param.name: SERVO10_FUNCTION
param.documentation: Function assigned to this servo. Setting this to Disabled(0) will setup this output for control by auto missions or MAVLink servo set commands. any other value will enable the corresponding function

param.documentation: minimum PWM pulse width in microseconds. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_MASK
param.documentation: Enable of BLHeli pass-thru servo protocol support to specific channels. This mask is in addition to motors enabled using SERVO_BLH_AUTO (if any)

param.humanName: BLHeli pass-thru auto-enable for multicopter motors
param.name: SERVO_BLH_AUTO
param.documentation: If set to 1 this auto-enables BLHeli pass-thru support for all multicopter motors

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TEST
param.documentation: Setting SERVO_BLH_TEST to a motor number enables an internal test of the BLHeli ESC protocol to the corresponding ESC. The debug output is displayed on the USB console.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TMOUT
param.documentation: This sets the inactivity timeout for the BLHeli protocol in seconds. If no packets are received in this time normal MAVLink operations are resumed. A value of 0 means no timeout

param.name: SERVO_BLH_TRATE
param.documentation: This sets the rate in Hz for requesting telemetry from ESCs. It is the rate per ESC. Setting to zero disables telemetry requests

param.name: SERVO_BLH_DEBUG
param.documentation: When set to 1 this enabled verbose debugging output over MAVLink when the blheli protocol is active. This can be used to diagnose failures.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_OTYPE
param.documentation: When set to a non-zero value this overrides the output type for the output channels given by SERVO_BLH_MASK. This can be used to enable DShot on outputs that are not part of the multicopter motors group.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_PORT
param.documentation: This sets the serial port to use for blheli pass-thru

param.name: SERVO_BLH_POLES
param.documentation: This allows calculation of true RPM from ESC's eRPM. The default is 14.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_3DMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which are dynamically reversible. This is used to configure ESCs in '3D' mode, allowing for the motor to spin in either direction

param.humanName: BLHeli bitmask of bi-directional dshot channels
param.name: SERVO_BLH_BDMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which support bi-directional dshot. This is used for ESCs which have firmware that supports bi-directional dshot allowing fast rpm telemetry values to be returned for the harmonic notch.

param.name: SERVO_BLH_RVMASK
param.documentation: Mask of channels which are reversed. This is used to configure ESCs in reversed mode

param.name: SERVO_ROB_POSMIN
param.documentation: Position minimum at servo min value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

param.name: SERVO_ROB_POSMAX
param.documentation: Position maximum at servo max value. This should be within the position control range of the servos, normally 0 to 4095

param.name: SERVO_SBUS_RATE
param.documentation: This sets the SBUS output frame rate in Hz.

param.name: SERVO_VOLZ_MASK
param.documentation: Enable of volz servo protocol to specific channels

param.name: SID_AXIS
param.documentation: Controls which axis are being excited. Set to non-zero to see more parameters

param.name: SID_MAGNITUDE
param.documentation: Magnitude of sweep in deg, deg/s and 0-1 for mixer outputs.

param.name: SID_F_START_HZ
param.documentation: Frequency at the start of the sweep

param.name: SID_F_STOP_HZ
param.documentation: Frequency at the end of the sweep

param.name: SID_T_FADE_IN
param.documentation: Time to reach maximum amplitude of sweep

param.name: SID_T_REC
param.documentation: Time taken to complete the sweep

param.name: SID_T_FADE_OUT
param.documentation: Time to reach zero amplitude at the end of the sweep

param.name: SPRAY_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) the sprayer

param.name: SPRAY_PUMP_RATE
param.documentation: Desired pump speed when traveling 1m/s expressed as a percentage

param.name: SPRAY_SPINNER
param.documentation: Spinner's rotation speed in PWM (a higher rate will disperse the spray over a wider area horizontally)

param.name: SPRAY_SPEED_MIN
param.documentation: Speed minimum at which we will begin spraying

param.name: SPRAY_PUMP_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum pump speed expressed as a percentage

param.name: SR0_RAW_SENS
param.documentation: Stream rate of RAW_IMU, SCALED_IMU2, SCALED_IMU3, SCALED_PRESSURE, SCALED_PRESSURE2, SCALED_PRESSURE3 and SENSOR_OFFSETS to ground station

param.humanName: Extended status stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR0_EXT_STAT
param.documentation: Stream rate of SYS_STATUS, POWER_STATUS, MEMINFO, CURRENT_WAYPOINT, GPS_RAW_INT, GPS_RTK (if available), GPS2_RAW (if available), GPS2_RTK (if available), NAV_CONTROLLER_OUTPUT, and FENCE_STATUS to ground station

param.humanName: RC Channel stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR0_RC_CHAN
param.documentation: Stream rate of SERVO_OUTPUT_RAW and RC_CHANNELS to ground station

param.humanName: Position stream rate to ground station
param.name: SR0_POSITION
param.documentation: Stream rate of GLOBAL_POSITION_INT and LOCAL_POSITION_NED to ground station

param.humanName: Extra data type 1 stream rate to ground station

param.name: SRTL_ACCURACY
param.documentation: SmartRTL accuracy. The minimum distance between points.

param.humanName: SmartRTL maximum number of points on path
param.name: SRTL_POINTS
param.documentation: SmartRTL maximum number of points on path. Set to 0 to disable SmartRTL. 100 points consumes about 3k of memory.

param.name: SRTL_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Bitmask of SmartRTL options.

param.name: STAT_BOOTCNT
param.documentation: Number of times board has been booted

param.name: STAT_FLTTIME
param.documentation: Total FlightTime (seconds)

param.name: STAT_RUNTIME
param.documentation: Total time autopilot has run

param.name: STAT_RESET
param.documentation: Seconds since January 1st 2016 (Unix epoch+1451606400) since statistics reset (set to 0 to reset statistics)

param.name: TCAL_ENABLED
param.documentation: Enable temperature calibration. Set to 0 to disable. Set to 1 to use learned values. Set to 2 to learn new values and use the values

param.name: TCAL_TEMP_MIN
param.documentation: Minimum learned temperature. This is automatically set by the learning process

param.name: TCAL_TEMP_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum learned temperature. This is automatically set by the learning process

param.name: TCAL_BARO_EXP
param.documentation: Learned exponent for barometer temperature correction

param.name: TERRAIN_ENABLE
param.documentation: enable terrain data. This enables the vehicle storing a database of terrain data on the SD card. The terrain data is requested from the ground station as needed, and stored for later use on the SD card. To be useful the ground station must support TERRAIN_REQUEST messages and have access to a terrain database, such as the SRTM database.

param.name: TERRAIN_SPACING
param.documentation: Distance between terrain grid points in meters. This controls the horizontal resolution of the terrain data that is stored on te SD card and requested from the ground station. If your GCS is using the ArduPilot SRTM database like Mission Planner or MAVProxy, then a resolution of 100 meters is appropriate. Grid spacings lower than 100 meters waste SD card space if the GCS cannot provide that resolution. The grid spacing also controls how much data is kept in memory during flight. A larger grid spacing will allow for a larger amount of data in memory. A grid spacing of 100 meters results in the vehicle keeping 12 grid squares in memory with each grid square having a size of 2.7 kilometers by 3.2 kilometers. Any additional grid squares are stored on the SD once they are fetched from the GCS and will be loaded as needed.

param.name: TERRAIN_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Options to change behaviour of terrain system

param.name: TMODE_ENABLE
param.documentation: tmode (or "toy" mode) gives a simplified user interface designed for mass market drones. Version1 is for the SkyViper V2450GPS. Version2 is for the F412 based boards

param.name: TMODE_MODE1
param.documentation: This is the initial mode when the vehicle is first turned on. This mode is assumed to not require GPS

param.name: TMODE_MODE2
param.documentation: This is the secondary mode. This mode is assumed to require GPS

param.name: TMODE_ACTION1
param.documentation: This is the action taken when the left action button is pressed

param.name: TMODE_ACTION2
param.documentation: This is the action taken when the right action button is pressed

param.name: TMODE_ACTION3
param.documentation: This is the action taken when the power button is pressed

param.name: TMODE_ACTION4
param.documentation: This is the action taken when the left action button is pressed while the left (Mode) button is held down

param.name: TMODE_ACTION5
param.documentation: This is the action taken when the right action is pressed while the left (Mode) button is held down

param.name: TMODE_ACTION6
param.documentation: This is the action taken when the power button is pressed while the left (Mode) button is held down

param.name: TMODE_LEFT
param.documentation: This is the action taken when the left (Mode) button is pressed

param.name: TMODE_LEFT_LONG
param.documentation: This is the action taken when the left (Mode) button is long-pressed

param.name: TMODE_TRIM_AUTO
param.documentation: This is the amount of automatic stick trim that can be applied when disarmed with sticks not moving. It is a PWM limit value away from 1500

param.name: TMODE_RIGHT
param.documentation: This is the action taken when the right (Return) button is pressed

param.name: TMODE_FLAGS
param.documentation: Bitmask of flags to change the behaviour of tmode. DisarmOnLowThrottle means to disarm if throttle is held down for 1 second when landed. ArmOnHighThrottle means to arm if throttle is above 80% for 1 second. UpgradeToLoiter means to allow takeoff in LOITER mode by switching to ALT_HOLD, then auto-upgrading to LOITER once GPS is available. RTLStickCancel means that on large stick inputs in RTL mode that LOITER mode is engaged

param.name: TMODE_VMIN
param.documentation: This is the battery voltage below which no output limiting is done

param.name: TMODE_VMAX
param.documentation: This is the battery voltage above which thrust min is used

param.name: TMODE_TMIN
param.documentation: This sets the thrust multiplier when voltage is high

param.name: TMODE_TMAX
param.documentation: This sets the thrust multiplier when voltage is low

param.name: TMODE_LOAD_MUL
param.documentation: This scales the load test output, as a value between 0 and 1

param.name: TMODE_LOAD_FILT
param.documentation: This filters the load test output. A value of 1 means no filter. 2 means values are repeated once. 3 means values are repeated 3 times, etc

param.name: TMODE_LOAD_TYPE
param.documentation: This sets the type of load test

param.name: VISO_TYPE
param.documentation: Visual odometry camera connection type

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera X position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_X
param.documentation: X position of the camera in body frame. Positive X is forward of the origin.

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera Y position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_Y
param.documentation: Y position of the camera in body frame. Positive Y is to the right of the origin.

param.humanName: Visual odometry camera Z position offset
param.name: VISO_POS_Z
param.documentation: Z position of the camera in body frame. Positive Z is down from the origin.

param.name: VISO_ORIENT
param.documentation: Visual odometery camera orientation

param.name: VISO_SCALE
param.documentation: Visual odometry scaling factor applied to position estimates from sensor

param.name: VISO_DELAY_MS
param.documentation: Visual odometry sensor delay relative to inertial measurements

param.name: VISO_VEL_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry velocity measurement noise in m/s

param.name: VISO_POS_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry position measurement noise minimum (meters). This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

param.name: VISO_YAW_M_NSE
param.documentation: Visual odometry yaw measurement noise minimum (radians), This value will be used if the sensor provides a lower noise value (or no noise value)

param.humanName: Is the Video Transmitter enabled or not
param.name: VTX_ENABLE
param.documentation: Toggles the Video Transmitter on and off

param.name: VTX_POWER
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, the power level chosen will be rounded down to the nearest supported power level

param.name: VTX_CHANNEL
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Channel

param.name: VTX_BAND
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Band

param.name: VTX_FREQ
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Frequency. The frequency is derived from the setting of BAND and CHANNEL

param.name: VTX_OPTIONS
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Options. Pitmode puts the VTX in a low power state. Unlocked enables certain restricted frequencies and power levels. Do not enable the Unlocked option unless you have appropriate permissions in your jurisdiction to transmit at high power levels.
param.field: 0:Pitmode,1:Pitmode until armed,2:Pitmode when disarmed,3:Unlocked,4:Add leading zero byte to requests

param.name: VTX_MAX_POWER
param.documentation: Video Transmitter Maximum Power Level. Different VTXs support different power levels, this prevents the power aux switch from requesting too high a power level. The switch supports 6 power levels and the selected power will be a subdivision between 0 and this setting.

param.name: WINCH_TYPE
param.documentation: Winch Type

param.humanName: Winch deploy or retract rate maximum
param.name: WINCH_RATE_MAX
param.documentation: Winch deploy or retract rate maximum. Set to maximum rate with no load.

param.humanName: Winch control position error P gain
param.name: WINCH_POS_P
param.documentation: Winch control position error P gain

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED_UP
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED_DN
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_ACCEL
param.documentation: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

param.name: WPNAV_ACCEL_Z
param.documentation: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

param.humanName: Waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following
param.name: WPNAV_RFND_USE
param.documentation: This controls if waypoint missions use rangefinder for terrain following

param.name: WPNAV_JERK
param.documentation: Defines the horizontal jerk in m/s/s used during missions

param.name: ZIGZ_AUTO_ENABLE
param.documentation: Allows you to enable (1) or disable (0) ZigZag auto feature

param.name: ZIGZ_SPRAYER
param.documentation: Enable the auto sprayer in ZigZag mode. SPRAY_ENABLE = 1 and SERVOx_FUNCTION = 22(SprayerPump) / 23(SprayerSpinner) also must be set. This makes the sprayer on while moving to destination A or B. The sprayer will stop if the vehicle reaches destination or the flight mode is changed from ZigZag to other.

param.name: ZIGZ_WP_DELAY
param.documentation: Waiting time after reached the destination

param.name: ZIGZ_SIDE_DIST
param.documentation: The distance to move sideways in ZigZag mode

param.name: ZIGZ_DIRECTION
param.documentation: The direction to move sideways in ZigZag mode

param.name: ZIGZ_LINE_NUM
param.documentation: Total number of lines for ZigZag auto if 1 or more. -1: Infinity, 0: Just moving to sideways
